Reviews.Content: The Le pan tablet is crap im not really one to leave comments but a month after using it, it froze and wont come on. And you have to email them and they'll take another month to reply to ur email since their customer number doesnt work. If you dont want to be full of regrets save more money and buy a popular brand where customer service can attend to u. I have tried everything it still wont come on and i'm still wanting for their email

Reviews.Title: Good For Price
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Newman
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: I have now had three solid months of use out of the LePan. I have had NO PROBLEMS with it other than some of my dislikes from my ealier post.Since writing my initial post, my son (3 years old) watched movies which we transfered over from our computer for much of our 10 hour trip to Ireland (waiting in airports and flights) and it still had about 30% battery life with no additional charging needed. I am sure running wifi and bluetooth would significantly reduce this. Looking for a cheap tablet for entertainment and that you don't mind your kids using, this is one way to go.I have found the apps in the android market for word processing are a little clunky and unfortunatley as a teacher in a school that uses Microsoft Word, the interchange is not so smooth all the time. I can work much quicker (editing, creating, inserting tables, diagrams, etc) using my Lenovo ThinkPad and therefore have not actually used the tablet for work.Initial Reivew (First Few Weeks):Picked this up as a Cyber Monday Week deal from Amazon ($150). Purchased this for more of an entertainment tablet, but still to do a little work email/word processing, etc. Price went back up to $250. I would imagine price will keep dropping after December.Pros:- Cost- Netflix, Facebook, and other apps work great- Came with ICS installed- Easy work around to download and install Adobe Flash Player- Solid build for a cheap tablet- Bluetooth and wifi works as good if not better than my iphone 4, no problems so far as others report.- Easy connection to computer through bluetooth direct connect and also through supplied transfer cable.-Not good/Not Bad:- Battery Life (not the same as other tablets, but I adjusted the setting and can get 6 hours or so of heavy use -- wifi, websurfing, bluetooth (keyboard), netflix and email no problem. But for my needs, I can't imagine needing 6 hours of heavy use very often with out being able to plug in and charge.Cons:- No USB port for plugging in keyboard, USB flash drive, etc. (This was big for me, but have quickly gotten use to the fact that I need to use work arounds).- Tablet WON'T charge connected to USB port in computer.- Hard to find case (see below) and the cases I could find were more expensive compared to same brand for ipad.- Costly replacement cable, planning on being very careful of mine.Note: BEWARE of keyboard/case combinations that Amazon links with the LePan. I read many reviews before buying and many of them either do not work or need modifications. I purchased the Kensington Universal Pro Keyfolio (bluetooth) case and keyboard. A little costly but I have been very happy with this addition. Had it set up in minutes and my tablet works great with all ports/buttons open while fitting snug in the tabs. Maybe not as snug as other brands, but I have not had any slippage or felt uncomfortable with it. It is also easy to pop out when you want just the tablet. Highly recommend this purchase with the LePan.

Reviews.Title: A good value.  Just not as reliable as I would like.
Reviews.Author: DigityDad
Reviews.Content: First off, I have had this unit for almost a year.  Bought last January so this is a pretty long-term test.  I would have written a more flattering review in the first month but problem is over time I have had to invest a fair amount of time to keep the unit stable and working.  I don't have that kind of time anymore and find when I need it, it's either not connected to wifi, or has turned itself on and is dead.I'm sure there are fixes for these things if I invest a lot of personal time in the forums which provide a lot of detail, but as I say I don't have the time anymore.That said, I did get some good use out of it, and it was very inexpensive so I can't complain.  And now it has a second live as a wifi picture frame that automatically downloads pics from my Picasa "best of" album (so long as I connect it to wifi every now and then).  This is a pretty good use in itself given similar wifi digital frames the same size are the often more expensive.

Reviews.Title: Was very happy at first, but...
Reviews.Author: Deloachw
Reviews.Content: I purchased my TC970 last November from another website. I was very pleased at first. The tablet did everything I wanted it to do. Seven months later the tablet stopped booting. It would just get stuck on the startup screen and stay there. I contacted support and tried all suggestions as well as some I found online. Nothing worked. I then went through the lengthy RMA process and got a replacement refurbed tablet. The replacement tablet is far more glitchy than my original tablet. The battery lasts half as long and the tablet freezes and has to be reset several times a day. It also drops the Wi-Fi connection frequently when it goes into standby mode. I hope the replacement tablet lasts longer than the seven months of my first tablet, but we will see. I would suggest possibly looking at the Google Nexus 7 before buying this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Spend the money and get ANYTHING else
Reviews.Author: Breanna
Reviews.Content: Worst purchase I have made in a while. I am actually on my second Le Pan because the first one froze up within 2 days and couldn't be reset. Amazon was wonderful about the return! This tablet freezes all of the time, when you touch the screen it often won't recognize that you did, it seems to have difficulty picking up a wireless signal no matter how strong it is. Apps like my email and facebook never seem to work correctly and facebook never seems to be able to retrieve notificaions. I bought this because I'm  backpackng through Central and South America and wanted something light weight I could use to keep up with friends and Skype but the camera is so terrible that they can hardly see me and the sound in both directions is so muffled that we're constantly saying 'What?'. The one positive is that the battery seems to be pretty ok so far, not great but ok. If I weren't in Panama, I would be trying to get my money back. Unless you're only using it to play solitare, it will be useless, and even then I wouldn't be too sure.

Reviews.Title: Its a very decent tablet!
Reviews.Author: J. Barnes "A part time reader, and full time ...
Reviews.Content: This Android Tablet is quite amazing. It works well with Apps, has the memory to handle all the work load, and can play movies with ease. The only thing is that it will freeze when its loaded with a lot of programs running at once. If you use it one thing at a time, and carefully, it works like clock work!Pro: Speed, basic tablet, and can handle the load of AppsCon: Can freeze when challenged with a lot of programs going on at once.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant about the Lepan I read about freeze ups but that is a no issue. It works better than I could have expected. Great product at a great price.

Reviews.Title: GOOD!
Reviews.Author: Hernan M.
Reviews.Content: Good! I recommend this tablet, cheap and has the same android apps of the phones and can read your ebooks

Reviews.Title: Good for the money
Reviews.Author: Nloner
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet and it was just ok. I'm still trying to figure out how to update it to ice cream sandwich. Every time I do so it freezes up on me or it just stops mid way through.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work.
Reviews.Author: Burnt toast
Reviews.Content: after hassling with this thing for three days I finally sent it back and haven't considered a tablet since. word

Reviews.Title: RUN AWAY DON'T DO IT
Reviews.Author: john h
Reviews.Content: 7/21/12 Purchased7/27/12 received8/05/12 started to freeze up8/06/12 stopped working8/09/12 Called Amazon they would send a new unit8/15/12 received new unit10/19/12 no power up at all, completely dead10/22/12 Amazon said it is out of warranty. "POS"10/22/12 Called LE PAN Customer service, was disconnected 3 timesjust through in trash.Don't do it, just buy a good 1.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the money
Reviews.Author: V M
Reviews.Content: This tablet is a great product for the money, especially with the ICS upgrade. I am a techie so I had no problems upgrading, I might even root this device later if needed. I got to install Flash through the .apk file and that works great too. It works great with a bluetooh wireless keyboard too.Only wish if the device drivers were signed by the company. It's kinda suspicious looking that these aren't signed, so I ran a system wide malware-virus scan after I installed them and even pre-scanned them before installation. Nothing found, but it's more professional to have signed distributions.Also, having a USB port would be nice (besides to 30-pin to USB) and a better camera than the 2MP.Overall, would recommend this to anyone looking for value for money.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!! Must Buy- Value for Money
Reviews.Author: SAM
Reviews.Content: Ok! I got this tablet two days back and I am amazed..simply amazed how good it is! Smooth flow of UI..never lags up ..runs video. I was so skeptical after I ordered it since I read negative reviews about tablet shutting down and not working thereafter and problems latching to wifi. But I didn't face any such problems. I upgraded to ICS and it was breeze. Let me tell you I have two laptops,one china made cheap tab and one samsung galaxy 7'' wifi. The china made tab that i had earlier was a piece of junk so when I ordered lepan 2 , i thought I am making same mistake again but NO!!!! It was way beyond my expectation.I took this because 7'' screen was too small for me at work. But this one is just perfect. The resolution is just mind blowing its as good as an ipad only less expensive. I should thank le pan guys for making technology affordable. It snapy fast, leaves even my galaxy tab far behind which has a 1 Gig of processor.Only minor flaw is the volume rocker ..too flat to identify it. A USB port would have been a added bonus. However with the price tage of just $279 it's a steal.A must buy !!!

Reviews.Title: This is a very good tablet
Reviews.Author: old guys rule
Reviews.Content: I've had the Lepan II tablet for about 2 months now and have nothing but praise for it.  Out of the box it was very easy to use. The quality is excellent. It is a great product for the price.  For the price I don't think you can do any better. I'm still waiting for the IceCream Sandwhich upgrade to become available - hopefully that will happen soon.  I looked at many tablets available in this price range and decided on the LePan II after reading the many reviews that give the device a high reputation. You can spend more but I'm not sure it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised
Reviews.Author: Theosts
Reviews.Content: I have had the Lepan 2 about 2 months now, so I think I have run it through it's paces enough to give a good review. My Lepan 2 was delivered in about 4 days so no issues with waiting. The tablet came with V118 version firmware already installed. I have had no problems with wifi connections and have tried at about 5 different locations with various types of routers. All apps I have installed seem to work fine. I did have to reinstall Skype once because the video did not work first time around.I added a 32 gb sd card (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004G60AD6/ref=oh_details_o06_s00_i00) which works out fine for adding movies, music and pictures. The LePan 2 does not allow apps to be loaded on the extra sd card however, or maybe I just have not figured out how to do this yet.I bought the Targus case (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B005BZNE1Q/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i00) which works great, but is a little thick and heavy. I use it around the house, but when traveling I use a very simple neoprene Ipad sleeve I got on Ebay for 4 bucks.As a screen protector I use this: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B003D8GAA0/ref=oh_details_o04_s00_i00. It comes with three protectors that do need some trimming. The protector does apply very easily without bubbles as long as you clean the screen very well with the cleaning cloth that comes with the Lepan. The protector is quite thick but I have not noticed any delays on the touch screen after adding this.All in all I have thoroughly enjoyed the LePan 2 tablet so far to browse the internet, watch movies and TV shows online, stream Netflix, Pandora and play some games I found on the Google Marketplace. If you are in doubt, give it a chance. It's a great tablet for the price.Update July 5, 2012:I just returned from a two and a half week vacation in Germany and France with the Le Pan 2. The LP2 worked on all wifi routers I tried with no problems. I was able to keep up on emails, FB, etc without a problem. I'm still very glad I bought it!

Reviews.Title: Worked amazingly at first but now it froze.
Reviews.Author: Mariah
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet on the HSN channel on TV and I was so happy and excited when I got it because I won't be having a computer after today so I was gonna use that as my computer. 6 days after turning it on and it froze completely and I can't do anything on it now. Before today, I actually liked it better than the iPad but now I don't recommend buying and getting your hopes up. Also, some things to keep in mind when buying it, you can't video chat on it. I downloaded Skype and tried video calling my brother's iPod touch via Skype but you can only call them like you would on a cell phone and even then the mic sucks. The camera also isn't very good. The only solution I can think of to getting my LePan tablet to work again is pushing the tiny reset button on the back and restoring it to the original settings but even then I might run into this problem again and I would rather just send it back than dealing with the hassle of resetting it all the time. So sad and disappointed :(

Reviews.Title: choppy YouTube videos!
Reviews.Author: arto4ever "arto"
Reviews.Content: the screen looks great and all but when you wanna watch any you tube video the image pauses several times during a video even when i have an excellent Wi-fi signal .  other than that is good for the price.

Reviews.Title: REPLACEMENT good so far
Reviews.Author: mamasloan
Reviews.Content: Received LePan early March.  Was quite impressed until it died after about 3 days and after dealing with customer service to reset factory settings because of Wifi problems.  Was told it was defective and to send to LePan.  They received it March 15th and it took them 6 weeks to send a replacement.  Kept checking status every week or so and was told they were backlogged processing RMAs (returns)....how many returns did they have?!!?  I told them their internal problems were not the customer's problems.  Why would a company share that info with customers?I've had the replacement about 2 weeks and so far so good.  I hope there are no more problems because I don't want to have to send it back and wait another 6 weeks while they get their act together.I gave them only 3 stars because of their lack of customer service.  If you don't experience any problems with the tablet it's a nice product for the money.FYI.....forget about their "hotline" because the most you'll receive is a recording.  I had even complained to Amazon and they couldn't get through either.  Need to go to their website and communicate via their Support.Will update if I have anymore problems.

Reviews.Title: Major problem with touchscreen after activating from standby...
Reviews.Author: Riv3r
Reviews.Content: Upon activating the tablet after it's been in standby mode for a while, the touchscreen becomes essentially non-functional for several minutes.  For example, after activating from standby and reaching the unlock screen with a pattern, I tried numerous times trying to swipe the correct pattern.  However, for some reason, the touchscreen would never "maintain" the line I tried drawing while swiping over the circles.  The line would always "breakup" before I could finish the pattern for 4 circles.  It seemed to be skipping from one circle to the next without any continuous connection.  This happened for about 5 minutes, until it finally read my finger swipe correctly and unlocked.  Frustrated, I decided to try a password lock instead of a pattern.  So I put the tablet on standby for a while, reactivated it, and tried putting in my password via the keyboard.  However, whenever I pressed a key, it would read it as double, sometimes even triple (e.g. pressing the 'd' key once, would result in 'dd' or 'ddd' being entered into the password field).  This happened with all the other keys I pressed, and continued for several minutes, until it stopped doing it all of a sudden and was finally able to put in my password.  Frustrated again, I turned off any lock.However, not being able to control the unlock screen with finger swipes wasn't the only issue after returning from standby.  Whenever I tried to use pdfs after returning from a long standby, I could not control scrolling or zooming.  Anytime I tried scrolling, it would zoom in and out.  This would continue for several minutes until it would finally function normally.So it's pretty clear that with my tablet, something happens to the touchscreen functionality after it's been in standby for a while.  I always had to wait several minutes after activating from standby for the touchscreen to work properly.  The touchscreen keyboard must be "reloading" during that time, or something.  But yea, this is unacceptable for me.  I tried doing a factory reset as well as downloading the new firmware, but it still kept giving me the same problem.  I really wanted to enjoy this tablet since everything else works decently, but this one major flaw with the touchscreen has led me to return this tablet.I've been anti-Apple for the longest time, but after trying out the ipad 3 and its retina display, I think I may take the plunge and get it.  I had narrowed my tablet choices to only 4:3 format because my main uses are reading pdfs, textbooks, and magazines, and it looks like the ipad is the only other option out there.  Also, that retina display makes pdfs look amazing, especially small font on documents.  I had considered the Coby Kyros Android 4.0 with the 9.7 inch screen, but the negative reviews turned me off to it.It's possible that it was just my Le Pan 2 touchscreen that was defective, so hopefully you future purchasers of this tablet don't run into the same problem.

Reviews.Title: Good as a first tablet PC
Reviews.Author: Lana
Reviews.Content: It's quite  a nice device and it became even better after I managed to make it work with bluetooth keyboard :)

Reviews.Title: Good and Bad
Reviews.Author: Constant Researcher
Reviews.Content: I researched this tablet and suggested "we" buy this tablet for my niece's children for Christmas. We all pitched in and made it a nice Santa gift.  She bought two and liked them for a time.  In January, I purchased one myself and like it very much.  The problem is that this item freezes quite regularly and I don't know why, which means constant resetting.  My nephew's tablet had to be returned to LePan for service last month, after 3 months of use. A month later, it is still not back from the manufacturer.  Calling this company is very hard to get through to -- actually almost impossible.  The times that we did get through we were told they were totally backed up.  I'm not sure I like the sounds of that.  We now have a total of 3 of these units in our family and we did purchase the Square Trade warranty, but they only kick in after the LePan warranty expires.  For the money, I still like my unit, but am unhappy with the repair service my nephew received, and since I am the one who  did the research and suggested this, I feel badly about it.  He is a 12-year-old boy who really missed his tablet for a month.  My review would have been higher had I not had this experience with inability to contact the company after needing service shortly after purchase. I think most of us know that customer service can make or break a company no matter how good a product is.  More accessability to this company would have helped my rating immensely. Thanks.September 3,  2012I really hate to give bad reviews to any company trying to make competitive products in this market.  However,  this is probably one of the worst purchases i have made.  As noted,  we have 3 in the family and they have all been sent back once and need to go back again at the cost of $15 in postage everytime. If there were a class action suit against these tablets I would join it.  I can not even turn the tablet on unless I stick a pin in the reset hole so now iI keep a safety pin with my case! I find this as good as throwing $230 into the garbage disposal.

Reviews.Title: I like it!
Reviews.Author: vmurphy03
Reviews.Content: I first saw the Le pan on HSN and was impressed by the presentation, and the 5 payments of $50 and change!  I don't have a smart phone and won't have one for awhile, until my Verizon contract is up lol and have been interested in a tablet.  This got my attention so I ordered it!  I really like it- it's fun.  I think it's not for high-tech people, but for us just getting into the tablet game at a price we can afford.  I can do what I want to do on it-watch youtube, tv, netflix, play around with apps, etc, in any room of my house because of the wifi and if I ever feel like taking advantage of the front-facing camera there are possibilities like Skype and chat.  I'm new to Android so it's been a learning experience!Le Pan TC 970 9.7-Inch Multi-Touch LCD Google Android Tablet PC

Reviews.Title: Exceptional budget tablet.
Reviews.Author: Alvy Singer
Reviews.Content: As of writing, this tablet now supports CyanogenMod7, which is Android 2.3. (Gingerbread). By contrast, the stock ROM comes with Android 2.2 (Froyo), which is still acceptable but obviously suboptimal for a tablet that can run something better. A brief Google search will get you started. I was able to switch everything over in about an hour.Second, the battery life for this thing is amazing. I charge it so infrequently that I'm often taken aback by how much power it's not using in between charges. I can't even remember the last time I had to plug it in, though I tend to charge it up anyway just in case the zombie apocalypse happens while I'm at work and I need to locate safe houses on my way to the capitol or something. Anyway, if you're looking for a tablet that can do better than "maybe 6 hours on a single charge if you're lucky", this is the way to go.Other pros include surprisingly powerful speakers, good Wi-fi reception even with a low signal, an acceptable screen for the price, and so on. Although I wouldn't say it's designed specifically to be ergonomic, it's still comfortable to hold. Pretend it's a Dualshock for maximum grip comfort.Not much to say when it comes to negatives. Since it's not Honeycomb, actual made-for-tablet-app support is somewhat spotty. About half of my apps notice it's a tablet anyway. The other half just run in regular mode. I've yet to have this be a big issue, but I do wish I could use all the new tablet apps out there. Other than that, the glossy screen smudges easily, which is what you signed up for when you get a tablet in general I suppose. Customer service is limited from what I hear, although it's not like Android is really complicated enough to warrant its necessity. Overall, no dealbreakers, but some downsides.Note to those who bought this, I've found Acase Premium Leather Slimline Carrying Case for Apple iPad and HP TouchPad (Black) to be the best choice for a case. Fits perfectly, power button remains open for use, etc.

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this tablet. I bought it as a gift for my grandson. It is a very good value for the money. The screen is bright and it is the perfect size.  I just don't understand why anyone chooses to ship with USPS. The shipping is slow. It was very well packaged.

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet but freezes
Reviews.Author: athorn
Reviews.Content: Very nice design and fun to use but the screen started freezing on the 2nd day I had it. I called the manufactor and was told to stick a pin in the reset hole. This works but after 1 month of use the tablet continues to freeze randomly. I had the same problem with my Android phone, so maybe this is an Android problem and not specific to this tablet, or maybe not.

Reviews.Title: Dissatisfied Customer
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: I'm very disappointed with this product! I purchased 3 of these for Christmas, 1 of them worked. I had to return 2 of them for replacement. I had to wait about 2 weeks because they were out of stock. When I received the replacements, they were defective as well. I had no choice, I returned the two tablets. When I got the credit, I was charged 20%? Not a good experience! Can anyone tell me how I can dispute the 20% charge, and what are the chances of me getting it back? thx dave

Reviews.Title: Le Pan ii, a good deal so far
Reviews.Author: J. Brown "jaydub"
Reviews.Content: I've had mine for about 24 hrs now and must say i'm overall pleased. This is my first tablet (never owned a smart phone either) so I don't have anything to compare it to other than briefly playing with friends tablets a few times, android OS a little more difficult to use than I anticipated but I'm getting there. Issues I've encountered so far are: bluetooth has been dropping in and out when enabled, can't get the vpn to install on campus but picks up my wireless network at home fine( I even took it to my tech buddy today and he couldn't set up the vpn either), power button is a little hard to press (not a big deal), a pdf e-book I have is hard to read, but I may just be missing how to make the adjustments. I'm hoping some of those issues will be resolved once I learn how to use it and possibly talk to tech support. On the flipside, the responsiveness is good, nice screen, nice build, I've had no issues connecting to Wifi as others here have reported. Overall I'm satisfied.Will make an update if anything changes.

Reviews.Title: bad  tablet
Reviews.Author: azmtrepair
Reviews.Content: I got it from amazon and it worked great for about 2 weeks and than I lost all info on day and i cant  get it to connect to the internet at all I cant get hold of customer service  so Ill send it back to Amazon and  get a differant  kind I guess  Lepan  tablet isnt worth the head aches

Reviews.Title: Le Pan II
Reviews.Author: Melissa Lanner "M.Lanner"
Reviews.Content: I love my le pan ii. Too bad it doesn't play hulu.com since hulu recognizes as a mobile device n wants u to use hulu plus but oh well. Netflix & YouTube apps are awesome. Syncs to gmail just fineNo problems with the wifi as previously discussed. Battery life, use airplane mode when not in use, make sure to not leave it idle. Keyboard response time is excellent. Micro sd slot is plus too! So glad I didn't purchase the Ipad. Just a reminder this is a tablet!

Reviews.Title: cheap piece of crap
Reviews.Author: MC Hammer "MC"
Reviews.Content: 3 months after purchase, the tablet doesn't turn on anymore. It started the same day the claim guaranty from amazon run out... I will try to contact the seller but do not expect much from them after all the bad comments I read here...

Reviews.Title: good at first
Reviews.Author: le pan
Reviews.Content: i wouldn't suggest this i would hold out for a better one i play on my wife's kindle fire and it runs so much smoother there is no comparison. Yes the screen is smaller but i have had to reset mine a whole bunch and it runs slow sometimes and it also randomly searches or the keyboard screen will come up in the middle of a game and a few other things that doesn't make it the best buy.

Reviews.Title: very nice
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: This tablet is great!  It does everything my phone does except make phone calls of course. Perfect when you're on the go. I am very satisfied

Reviews.Title: Love it...but wifi is seriously irritating me.
Reviews.Author: P. Campbell
Reviews.Content: I just received my Le Pan II yesterday and at first my wifi worked perfectly and connected with no problem. Today...it was a different story. I have not been able to use my le pan ALL day. I cant get it to connect to my internet. All it keeps saying is "obtaining IP address" and then just when it says" remembered" it goes right back to trying to obtain the address again. It is so frustrating. But overall when I could connect to the internet it worked great. Nice screen and speed. I have been searching in the threads to find the fix for the wifi but its a lot to read through.I would definitely recommend this tablet to those of you who are on a budget and need a nice tablet.*UPDATE*Well after hours of trying to figure It out....I disabled the security on my router,  reset it, restarted my computer and tada! It connected! Problem...there is no security on my router. I'm afraid to enable security on it it my not connect again! I'm gonna Google how to set up an IP static address for my tablet. Thanks everyone for your comments and help.*UPDATE March 5th*Well I just ended up buying a new router over the weekend, a Netgear. Worked perfectly!! Connected with no problem whatsoever!! Now I can't put my Le Pan down..loving it.

Reviews.Title: great tablet
Reviews.Author: andy
Reviews.Content: I purchashed this item like 2 days ago but too bad i must return it. First, this tablet freeze like crazy!! It has been frozen on me for more then 5 times sincr i got the tablet so i thought mine was defected but when i looked at the reviews from other people, apparently they are all experiencing the same problem. I say this tablet is not too bad for only 200 bucks but if you dont mind carrying a tooth pick on you all the time so that you could reset the tablet when it freezes, go for it and buy it. Btw im writing this review with the tc 970 right now and i have to say its pretty bad, the touchscreen is not to accurate so i had to keep pressing thedelete button and you have to tap quite hard as well.

Reviews.Title: le pan tc 970
Reviews.Author: Ronald L. Pierce "Big E"
Reviews.Content: First tablet PC i have own. Works very good so far. Had the unit for a month now. It does freeze up sometimes but that's no problem since it has a reset button. Very fast, does what i need it to. Going to take it to church today and use it as my Bible since it already has a Bible app install. The Bible app has many Bibles on it and you can download a version for off line use when WiFi is not possible .. Like the big screen, and the weight is about 1.6 pounds.  I did not buy this from Amazon, this is not a knock on Amazon but the price where i bought it was so much cheaper at the time i bought it . Most place wanted around $249.00 and i got this for a $198.00 great price. Update. Had this tablet now almost 2 years and it has held up very well. No problems with it.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME TABLET!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Lover
Reviews.Content: I can't tell you how pleased we are with this tablet.  This was a Christmas present for my teenage son.  He loves it! :) I love it!It does take a little getting used too, but it didn't take but a day of playing around with this tablet to know the ins and outs of how it works.I am very impressed with the GPS feature and the Talk Google feature.  The Picture and Sound is incredible!  I am able to listen to Youtube videos.  I did download Look Out Security  & Adobe Flash -  2 very MUST HAVE apps toProtect your Tablet  & Adobe Flash to get the most out of your tablet Pc.I wasn't able to do the update, but everything was working just fine.  I spoke with Customer Service (Very Friendly, and Quick Response the couple times I had spoke and emailed them) Customer Service said there wasno reason for me to do the update if it was working fine.  I agree, its been working just fine.I downloaded several apps for my son, so he could actually start using it right away on Christmas Day.I did discover that I had Yahoo Messenger and Facebook both running in the background and I didn't realize that, and it made my mic stop working.  I went into the settings and stopped running those 2 apps (which I thought I had already closed) Turned the Tablet off and back on, and the mic has worked fine every since.  My son downloadedSkype and Skyped with his Friends.The case Amazon had suggested that go with this Tablet,(  10.2" Synthetic Leather Case with Keyboard and Stylus Pen for ePad and aPad (Black)) didn't work. Honestly, I had ordered this together with the tablet per Amazon's suggestion, if I would have known how good the virtual keyboard that is built right in the tablet worked, I wouldn't have bothered going with amazon suggestion to purchase with this tablet.Amazon (since it was their suggestion and error)Amazon Fully Refunded my money, and Thanks to some Previous Reviewers (Thank You)  I discovered this Tablet cover works nicely with this tablet:However, I still strongly suggest a Case to Protect your tablet:  (this one works Fabulous with this tablet)The Case that Does Work with this Tablet is:Targus Truss Leather Carrying Case with Stand for Apple iPad 16GB, 32GB, 64GB WiFi and WiFi + 3G THZ022US (Black/Turquoise Interior)http://www.amazon.com/Targus-Carrying-THZ022US-Turquoise-Interior/dp/B003VANVB6/ref=sr_1_1?s=electronics&ie;=UTF8&qid;=1325843718&sr;=1-1It is a fingerprint magnet.  So, I have on order a Screen protector and some stylus pens to help with this :)For $198 (that is the cost around Thanksgiving) We were pleased! :)I was so impressed, I ordered a LePan II for myself, Glad I preordered for $262 for the LePan II - I see it went up to around $300.  Looking forward to my LePan II coming next week, and I will review and post about that one too!You will NOT be DISAPPOINTED with this TABLET!  In my opinion it does 99% what an IPAD does but hundreds of dollars cheapier!

Reviews.Title: One of the best for the price
Reviews.Author: StuBDue
Reviews.Content: When picking up this tablet, you can tell it is built well. The screen is gorgeous and this tablet is fast. You can find screen protectors and some cases to fit it. There are actually some things I like about it better than the iPad 1 I had but being a Mac guy I get frustrated by the hoops you have to jump thru to sync music, etc. It does occasionally freeze but a simple reset is quick. I don't think the speakers are as bad as many have stated. Support so far has been good and prices for extra cables, etc is reasonable. I bought this thinking I would try it and return it but I have decided to keep it .... $199 at Big Lots. Only frustration has been that the Apple cable does not seem to fit (tad too wide) because they look exactly alike. In closing, you can't beat it for the price.StuBDue

Reviews.Title: LePan TC970 is the best Android 2.2 Tablet for the price
Reviews.Author: Roy Wallace "w3junkie"
Reviews.Content: I had been wanting to break into the Android realm for some time but was not ready to trade up my Nokia N8 which still does 90% of what I need from a Smartphone. However, recently while traveling on small prop-jets, I have found that even my 12" Asus netbook is too big for effective use and my N8 is too small for reading eBooks and watching videos. So I asked my wife for the LePan TC970 as a Christmas gift. Has true Google App. Market. Most downloaded apps work without problem. Has built-in wireless 'N' so wifi is fast. Works with the latest version of Skype including video.So far, I have been more than happy.PROS: Amazing price ($179 through Amazon). Great screen display and resolution (1024x768) for full web-pages, photos and videos. Reasonable sound for such a small device. Includes GPS and bluetooth not often found on lower-end devices. Relatively quick and responsive. Capacitive screen works as expected.CONS: Has trouble playing some video file formats. Can not be upgraded beyond Android 2.2 (froyo). Relatively small user base means lack of support compared to other major brands. Skype video is quirky and poor quality.All-in-all, I have to say that this was a great purchase and the LePan TC970 has become my device of choice when I just need to surf, email or play recreationally.

Reviews.Title: EXTREME Value on High Function Tablet
Reviews.Author: fastreader
Reviews.Content: Where to start with this is the problem as my wife has been wowed by this early Christmas present; and I have been impressed with it's technical capabilities.On the upside:1) spectacular graphics capability2) fast download and upload speed on our home wi-fi network3) a nice variety of free aps are available at the Android store4) runs NetFlicks even in Canada - it was a painless install that literally took 30 seconds5) responds to touch screen movements as expected6) multiple home pages means you can specialize each one - games, business etc7) comes with gmail installed8) great battery life9) senses amount of light in room and adjusts screen10) can prety well do what an iPad or Blackberry can do11) GREAT value for the priceOn the downside:1) fingerprints on the screen - really what did we expect with a touch screen2) glossy frame and glass screen means lots of reflections3) no owners manual installed or avalable so you need to be a litle bit of a computer geek if you want to customize it - although most activities seem intuitiveWhen I ordered this I also ordered the 32GB microcard as it only comes with 2GB installed.At $169 THIS IS HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Reviews.Title: Perfect Tablet
Reviews.Author: mjschad
Reviews.Content: This had to be one of the best gifts I bought this year.  Easy setup, large screen, just perfect.  And it was a gift for my mom.  She loved it.  (she's 70 years old!)  It was everything the description said it would be.  I had bought a different tablet for my nephew, which sucked, and am returning it and buying this one for him as well.

Reviews.Title: Too Bad
Reviews.Author: Glenn A. Army
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews within Amazon and several tech site reviews many LE Pan owners and technical geeks gave the device very favorable reviews. However Too bad that this device continued to freeze and a hard reset was required to get it working again, only to have it freeze again in less than two minutes of running time. It had everything you could want in a tablet for a very good price, the only two faults I found was the freezing and that you can't upgrade the Android 2.2 OS to the newest 4.0 Android OS. I had to return the Le Pan and will order a Toshiba Thrive or a Acer Iconic, both have very good reviews. Amazon was very quick with the return process and refund. Le Pan TC 970 9.7-Inch Multi-Touch LCD Google Android Tablet PC

Reviews.Title: great tablet!
Reviews.Author: TheLordVincent
Reviews.Content: Like most, I was hesitant to purchase from a company I've never heard of.  However, I thought to myself that these are probably just made right across the street from the Chinese company that builds the IPads using the same labor pool.  I've had an IPhone for years and I have to say I like Android better.There's been some people who wonder about the lack of being able to upgrade from froyo, but this is really a minor issue.  Is it really that important to you to spend an extra $150+ on an operating system that most people won't know the difference in the upgrade?  I've used IPad's and I've used this Le Pan and I can honestly say that I'm struggling to see how anyone can equate paying the premium for an Apple product now.  Yeah, sure there's a few reviewers with defective TC 970's, but do you honestly think you're immune to getting a lemon if you go with an iPad?  The way I see it, you can purchase three of these to everyone iPad and that's a huge price difference.In conclusion, if you're an everyday user, you'll never know what you're missing on an updated operating system-sure tech people could distinguish the nuances (the kindle fire/nook tablet uses a much more restricted OS to put it in prospective.)  And it's CHEAP!  Buy it with average expectations and you'll be blown away.

Reviews.Title: Dissapointed
Reviews.Author: BB
Reviews.Content: After looking at reviews for the Le Pan TC 970 my husband and I were excited about purchasing it. Out of over 100 reviews only 7 at the time were rated 1 or 2 stars so we thought the odds of getting a defective tablet was low. We were wrong. The day we received it we turned it on and was able to look around in for a little bit and before we even got the chance to plug it in and let it charge it froze up. I contacted their tech support who advised to let it charge overnight and even gave us directions on how to reset it or do a system reboot. After a week of constantly rebooting every day we decided to return it. I was sad that it didn't work out for us but even if there were no defects I felt the tablet was just a larger version of my android phone and was too practical in my every day life.

Reviews.Title: Best Tablet Ever!!!
Reviews.Author: luvelle911
Reviews.Content: I have been using this Le Pan TC 970 9.7-Inch Multi-Touch LCD Google Android Tablet PC now for a while now. I wanted to wait until I had a chance to play with it and see how it works before I wrote a review.The Le Pan came with everything as promised. It shipped and arrived fairly quickly via USPS with amazon free shipping. Upon opening the box, I found everything inside that was promised- tablet, charger, and manual. Of course it needed charging and I plugged it in overnight.When I started to use the tablet I found it was pretty similar to my IPhone, but it was Android instead of Apple. It took me little time to get familiar with the tablet because of my past experience. The Google Marketplace was installed and it was easy to browse and install various apps that I wanted.I have been able to upload many of the apps that I use on my phone as well as an "office" suite for all my docs I want to have with me. I was able to find an internet browser that supports most of the movie formats and that is a great addition. I have been using the USB plugs to bring many items from my desktop into the pad and the fact that it has memory card slots- micro sd- i am able to change it our with all my other device that i have with me, makes its memory grow. It come with a 2G micro SD but i change it out a 8G card cause all my other device like my camera and my the HTC phone both use the same type of SD card, so this made it fairly easy to upload and switch out files for me. The camera works well and overall, I have had no problems with the unit.I think my experience with the Iphone has helped in knowing how the tablet works and give me a guide line and a better understanding on how the Le Pan Tablet work. It is no different than when you go from Windows to Windows 7- it takes a little time to get used to something new.This is one slick little gadget that I am finding it very useful- at $200-300 less than an i-Pad and with more standard features- it is a great buy!

Reviews.Title: Display is not bright enough
Reviews.Author: seulater
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this tablet.Though it is fast and works well i have no troubles using it at all.I have owned over 10 tables over the last 3 years, so i have much to compare against.I liked everything about it, but the golden test for me is how well videos play.I was very disappointed that in playing videos the screen brightness is just not there. It causes videos to be far to dark for me.People with dark clothing causes it to look totally black. I will be returning this tab.

Reviews.Title: great tablet but wont connect to my wifi
Reviews.Author: zip420
Reviews.Content: Would be 5 star but won't connect to my "clear wireless 4g modem ? Don't know y but does connect to my phones wireless hot spot. The HDMI output works great crystal clear. If wifi worked would be a 5 star this is a great tablet but have to download apk files from Internet then save them o SD and install great tablet for the price and ICS update looks and works great. Just remember when updating from le pans website to download the zip not the rar. And unzip and has everything you need just follow the instructions. I would recommend this tablet to anyone just make sure your wifi is compatible.

Reviews.Title: Le Pan II Not too Happy
Reviews.Author: LisaH
Reviews.Content: First-i am a user and owner of the Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1 (which i dropped and borke-without isnurance to fix) and exhaustively researched replacement options for the Tablet. I really didn't see any reason to pay such a premium with so many options in the market right. I really researched all the tabs on the market and really was sold on the Le-Pan II. I loved the Micro Sd option it offered in particular.I got the package promptly after placing the order and quickly opened it up. Everything was there. I charged fully overnight and then powered up the next morning. It went through the boot process and opened to the main unlock screen. to m y horror the unit would not react to any finger touches anywhere on the entire screen. I tried to power off but couldn't use my finger to select the turn off prompt on the screen. I used the reset button with a paperclip as suggested six times. Every time i reset i got as far as the unlock screen.While its only been day one and i am returning the unit for a replacement i am very dissapointed that the first one didn't work right out of the box. I have heard so many good things about Le-Pan. Its a solid well built unit but if it doesn't get beyond the first screen its just another piece of clutter on my desk.They get one more try-the next unit needs to work or they lost me a customer for good and i wait till October for the next batch of tabs to come out and buy a new brand altogether

Reviews.Title: What a piece of crap
Reviews.Author: Dan S
Reviews.Content: The dam thing worked for 2 months and then just wouldnt turn on anymore. Biggest peice of garbage ever. Do yourself a favor and save up a few bucks extra for an IPAD. Never again, Also Amazon will not be refunding my full amount because it is past the date. I bought this crap for my sick dad who never opened it. Finally two months later when I go to use it doesnt work. F lepan.

Reviews.Title: Trash!!!
Reviews.Author: Karlly
Reviews.Content: Received the first one, didn't work at all.  Sent it back and received another one which only worked about a month.  Contacted Amazon and they said to contact the the manufacturer since there is a "known" issue.  Contacted them and they are sending a RMA # to return it at MY expense even though their product is garbage.  If I hadn't already purchased this and it's too late to get a refund, I certainly wouldn't want another one!!!

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS ITEM.... RUN AWAY NOW!
Reviews.Author: K. ross "wpi81"
Reviews.Content: This is criminal.  I am returning this product now.  They are selling this fraudulently.  There is a known wifi issue with this tablet...and they do not ever plan to fix it...and service knows about it.  You will work fine for a week or so...and then wifi will stop working...and no amount of effort will restore it...it is all over the web now...they are only fixing it on the le pan ii model....right...how nice of the them to sell this old crap that they know has an wifi issue.  I never write negative reviews...but this is so fraudulent...and broken.I have spent 2 weeks trying to fix this being lead down a path....that has not end...besides returning this piece of junk.  You get what you pay for in this case.  My ipad, Iphone and other gear just works.  This is not ready for prime time at all...this company should be ashamed of itself.  What kind of people would waste our time...Shame on you Le PAN....shame on you.You will get what you deserve.  You can not hide from the masses with social media in the hands of the masses...A totally ticked off customer...

Reviews.Title: Excruciating experience
Reviews.Author: Fire
Reviews.Content: It was only one week after I made the purchase when my Lepan tablet PC TC970 got turned off and never got back. I contacted the customer service. They said I had to ship them back the defected device and would either give me a brand new device or they would fix it for me and ship it to my home. Now it over 3 weeks I have been waiting for any news from their side but still nothing has changed. I have emailed their technical department several times, but I have not got any positive feedback. Their answer is, " it is still in the process and we do not exactly know when it can be available to send it to you". Their brand new Lepan did not work one week, and this is the way they fix it!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I have lost my money and wasted time buying their product. Maybe if I read such a review I would never lost my time and money on that product. It was a horrible mistake to buy it!!!! Now I regret. I do not even know if they would someday send the fixed Lepan to me or I have lost that plus my money.

Reviews.Title: Get the new firmware
Reviews.Author: WA Yankee in TN
Reviews.Content: I've had this tablet (my first) for a couple of weeks, and am very happy with its performance and features.  I also have an iPhone 4S so an iPad would have been a more compatible choice, but I wanted to try out the Android world and at this price it was relatively easy to do so.  I've been able to connect with every wifi hotspot I've tried so far (work, home, Starbucks, etc.) but frequently had to restart the machine to restore wifi connectivity after moving to a new location or after leaving the tablet idle for a time.  The new firmware upgrade (available at the Le Pan website) seems to have fixed that issue for me, so I can move seamlessly from one hotspot to another without having to restart.  The wireless signal strength also seems to be improved.  I've added a 32 gb microSD card and the Elsse Premium case (requires some mods to expose the ports, but it's only $9).  All in all, a fine introductory tablet.

Reviews.Title: Love this tablet. No regrets here!
Reviews.Author: J. Bartos
Reviews.Content: I just got this tablet a few weeks ago, after having an Acer A200. I exchanged it for this and am much happier. I had Skype issues with the Acer and have none with this tablet. Initially I liked the look of it much more. I have no connectivity issues and am currently writing this review on it. It is perfect for everything I need it for, light browsing, a few game apps, email and note taking at school or on the go. I can't say enough about it! Very pleased with my purchase. I am looking forward to seeing the Le Pan 3, and will probably give this to my fiancée. ;) Only issue I had was with my wireless setup and had to use a static IP, not a big deal. I'm glad I got to experience a different tab before this one... I like this screen ratio a lot more. No regrets! Very happy tablet user!

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: WilJ "WilJ"
Reviews.Content: I have had the Le Pan II for three days and am very happy with it. The performance is very good and the appearance is quite attractive. The screen quality is better than expected and the overall features of the tablet are a great value for the money.No longer a great value due to all of the new products on the market, this is a functional tablet but does not compare to the Google Nexus 7, that I also have.

Reviews.Title: Exciting
Reviews.Author: KC
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced for what you get. Powerful. Easy to handle. Quick set up. Everything I expected to get and more.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: JS
Reviews.Content: I have never heard of Le Pan before but I bought it because it's got a good price with seemingly good specs. After playing around with it, I'm totally in love with it. I am not a big tech person so pardon my descriptions if it sounds amateur.The pros:First of all very affordable.The interface is nice and clean and it runs apps smoothly.Stunning picture quality, crisp and sharp from all angles.Very easy to access everything and easy to configure, as expected from an Android system.Great touch sensitivity and responsiveness.Definitely a big plus on battery life.The cons:Some lagging occurs but rarely and when it does, it is not to a point that it will bother whatever you are doing.The speakers could be better, it's got too much static-y sound and it's quite uncomfortable to listen to when it's pumped up to maximum.The back of the unit gets dirtied up very easily, but not a big deal.Overall this is a great tablet with little flaws in my opinion. I will definitely suggest this to friends and family because I love it!~

Reviews.Title: Slow WiFi.... So what's the point??
Reviews.Author: M. tolentino
Reviews.Content: UPDATE:::::: After spending more time the other day with the tablet despite the wifi performance issues I noticed another problem... screen "bleeding"!  I know it's common to see a bit of light leakage but my tablet had significant light leaking from 3 sides.  I obviously never noticed it before since I could hardly do anything without a stable wifi connection but last night i tried watching a movie and it is very distracting especially on a black background.to make things worse there is a 15% restocking fee at online retailer i bought the tablet from.  now i'm stuck on whether to send the tablet in to Le Pan under warranty and likely wait forever to get it back or just get rid of it and deal with the 15% fee. :::::::::::::::::UPDATEFirst of all I really wanted to keep the Le Pan II based on the features you get at a great price.  Like others, I also work in IT and have tested the tablet on numerous Wifi networks and settings.  My main problem is the slow and inconsistent data speeds.  The wifi connection is strong and will stay connected but the data speeds are terrible.  So you can imagine anything from web browsing, youtube, facebook, or anything that requires data is painfully slow.For testing purposes I was lucky enough to have two (2) Le Pan II tablets on hand.  I also tested and compared the Le Pan's with a Nook Color (rooted), Ipad and a HP Touchpad (Rooted, running android).  I basically ran simple speed tests and comparisons on Web Browsing, Streaming Videos, etc.  Unfortunately the Le Pan's almost always came in last.  It would either hang, buffer or keep you waiting and waiting.  Even the Nook Color had a better browsing experience (speed wise).Don't get me wrong, the Le Pan II has alot going for itself especially considering the features at an awesome price.  But what's the point of owning a tablet if you can't get anything done online?As a side note, I've also tried dealing with Le Pan's customer support.  I tried calling numerous times and could never get a "live" person.  I tried e-mailing both the customer service and and support e-mails found on their website to no avail.  I've also opened "tickets" via their website and am yet to receive a response or reply.I'm pretty sure a simple firmware update can fix the WiFi issues but since customer support is almost non-existant, who knows when?

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: St. Mark Lion Rock
Reviews.Content: Great hardware and performance. I love the viewing angle - this is a plus for my sons to watch each other play games . Most happy with performance, stability and easy to use. Download lots of online app. from amazon store. Battery life is great! I get the 10 hours for normal usage.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding! One small glitch
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: I have read the reviews with wifi issues and streaking bleedover in the corners. I do not have any of these issues. My Le Pan II is running great. Outstanding little toy. Fantastic price. Paid $250 for it on pre order. Price has now jumped to $300. I have an IPad. With Android 3.2 the Le Pan keeps up with my IPad. It has been designed to be upgradeable when the next Android upgrade comes out. You just can't beat it for $250.

Reviews.Title: In love with my Le Pan tablet
Reviews.Author: linmoncha
Reviews.Content: In the beginning, I did hesitate since it's an out of nowhere brand and there're bunch of similar tablets on the search list. But after read through all the comments I decided why not give it a try. Especially this tablet has a 4:3 ratio display screen from a commonly used 16:9 scale on the market which is exactly what I am looking for.Well...after 2 weeks getting along with my le pan tablet, I have to admit its performance is amazingly way more than what I expected at first place. The screen is no doubt reaching my most satisfaction, big, vivid on the color, great sensitivity and easy to use. And also it's capable of handling multi-task without slowing down; I can watch online movies, view/share my images, do website browsing, check my emails and chatting with my friends at same time. It's a true pleasure using it honestly! Right now I don't even have to open my desktop pc and I can have my entertainment and routines done without any problem.There are indeed some imperfections on the tablet. The most dissatisfaction to me will be the storage space is little beyond the standard on the market although it is upgradable up to 32GB capacity. . It'll be great if it equip with one 8GB SD card from my point of view.But overall, I love it and i will keep using it as my portable entertainment device.

Reviews.Title: Cheap in price and quality.
Reviews.Author: Crystal Abert
Reviews.Content: I purchased this a year ago for Christmas. I read tons of reviews, but the price was so little that I chose to purchase. I don't hate this product but I do wish I would've waited and not purchased it. I wish I would've saved my money for a better tablet.Pros: It was cheap and easy to use. It is a cool design and has a nice screen. it is durableCons: Freezes a lot! Watching youtube videos is impossible. Freezes in the middle of videos and you have to reset the device.battery life is alright not the best. Apps run slow.

Reviews.Title: I was leary, lot of specs for the buck, seemed too good to be true...
Reviews.Author: brett sharp
Reviews.Content: I wasn't even so sure it was a good deal once we got it and tried it. It took a bit and I'm not sure why, but once it had been on and the tablet updated Google's play store, this thing is great, it looks nice, works well, runs everything we have tried. If I have to find a problem I'd say I do not like the switch that shuts off the auto rotation. It seems too easy to jostle if you don't have a case on it... I was afraid to buy this, I'd buy another, at least as of now. What more can I say, pleasantly surprised...I'll be blunt, if I could by an I pad or the big Samsung Galaxy tab, for this price, I would, but since they cost several times more expensive, I'm happy with this.I've had minor issues, but I'm geeky enough to have straightened them out without tech support. I am saying I find it a good value... I'm just trying to be abundantly clear... hence the update.

Reviews.Title: Best price and value for such a LARGE tablet!
Reviews.Author: ksp
Reviews.Content: Surpassed my expectations!  Great price, great product, great deal!  Upgraded to ICS in about 20 minutes and havent looked back since.  Would buy this product again if I needed another one.  Love it.Screen is larger then imagined; the tablet is super responsive and the graphics are as great or even better then that of the Ipad.  I purchased the Le Pan 2 tablet, 32gb Micro-sd card, tablet case and screen protector all for less then HALF of the cost of an Ipad.If your questioning this product due to its lack of notoritiy, please dont.  This is a great product and the ONLY thing holding it back in any way is its lack of familuarity in name.I expect this company to continue to do great things and build on its reasonably priced products... if I could buy stock in Le Pan I would.

Reviews.Title: great tool!
Reviews.Author: Leti
Reviews.Content: I was amazed by this product! I have seen IPAD and Samsung Galaxi but when I start using Le Pan I can tell you that you won't regreat of your purchase! and is so much cheaper than other brands.Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Not a good product
Reviews.Author: Jules
Reviews.Content: The LePan tablet quit working after having it a short time, we ordered a replacement. The replacement one didn't even turn on.  We upgraded to a samsung galaxy tablet 2.

Reviews.Title: Sorry I Purchased This Tablet!
Reviews.Author: Deborah C. Ormond "dw1958"
Reviews.Content: I've had this device since January 2012.  In March 2012, Le Pan replaced the unit because it was defective.I thought the replacement unit would work flawlessly.  I was wrong.  It has a big problem as far as I am concerned.  I can not watch HD videos on Youtube.  When I attempt to watch HD Youtube video the tablet just buffers, and buffers, and buffers.  The buffering issue is so annoying I just give up trying to watch the video, search for another video, get more annoying buffering, etc., and never get the experience of viewing HD Youtube video on the tablet!  Now, if I watch non-HD video (film quality of non-HD is horrible) I am forced to watch super poor quality, fuzzy looking film.I used to be thrilled about this tablet.  My view of this tablet has taken a 180 degree turn in the opposite direction.  I do not recommend this tablet at all.  I thought by saving money and choosing this cheaper tablet I got a great deal.  I was wrong.  Next tablet I buy is going to be an Ipad.  Apple produces reliable devices.

Reviews.Title: One of the best purchases I've ever made
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is the third tablet I've purchased, largely on the strength that it's Google certified against the Play store.  I had an Acer Iconia that I wound up giving to my father in law.  I purchased a Nook Tablet and returned it after a week.  This?  It's actually replaced the numerous laptops and Kindles around the domicile as my primary information consumption device.  It's not perfect.  Sometimes Flash buffering is quirky, and there are a number of apps that just plain don't work, usually obscure games I don't care about.  I really miss having Swype, which is apparently incompatible due to the screen form factor.  I think in the end, why I like it so much is because of the form factor.  9.7 inches is just right for holding in one hand while having easy readability and UI spacing, and it's all without Apple's suffocating user experience.  The biggest advantage over the 7" form factor?  PDFs.  I go to a lot of conferences with materials in PDF format, and seven inches is not going to cut it.  I move documents and e-books into my Dropbox on any PC and it opens with zero fuss seconds later.  Try that with iOS.  I've had an iPhone, Android phones, and even a terrible XP tablet at work back in the day.  Using this is a pleasure, and you get a lot of bang for your buck.UPDATE 7/30/2012Upgraded to the official Android 4.0.4 release a couple of weeks ago.  Still have access to the Google Play store, and still pleased as punch.  It runs somewhat faster, battery life lasts a LOT longer, and a number of app issues that existed under Honeycomb have been fixed.  A free Swype analogue is too be had with TouchPal Keyboard.  I've been comparing it to the iPad 2s some folks have at work, and wouldn't trade it for a second.  The advantage of DropBox and its local LAN sync plus custom third party apps over the iOS world really cannot be overstated.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: DAC
Reviews.Content: The LePanII tablet is a brand I have passed over not knowing it's origins etc, however after seeing a demo on a shopping show I relized it had features others do not. After further research I made the purchase through Amazon.Most other vendors were out of stk do to very high demand!! I recieved one with the newest update (v.118) and have had no problems.Pros: under $300.00,large 9.7 in screen,only one camera...(I prefer none), has SDcard slot, internal memory, latest honeycomb andriod 3.2 upgradable soon to ICS and probably more as I use it.Cons: None so far. I'm new to tablets and andriod so I think it's great.The LePanII at it's low price point is not plastic. It has an aluminum housing with chrome rails on both sides...

Reviews.Title: Exellent tablet can be as good as iPad 2 but half of the price
Reviews.Author: Mike ZH "Mike ZH"
Reviews.Content: I have an iPad 2 too. I would say I am very happy about my Le Pan II. It is almost as good as iPad 2 after I added 32G microSD. Only time having a problem was its restarting hanging ( caused by a downloded waterfall app used for desktop wallpaper) - have to press the reset using a pin - please do not follow some people's suggestion to restore to factory default.  After uninstall the app, the tablet never have a problem to turn on/off.  The Le Pan II can provide everything I need like my iPad2, I don't turn on my laptop often now. Overall, I am very happy about it, can't live without it.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: GARY
Reviews.Content: I was really excited about this tablet and looking forward to getting it. My excitement soon turned to frustration when I couldn't get it to connect with the Verizon network using my 4G Mobile router. It would connect to public hot spots. My desktop, laptop and Nook connect but the Le Pan would not. Le Pan's Support was not any help. They gave me a one sentence answer to my email. I took the tablet to the Verizon store along with my mobile router to see if they could get it to work but no one could. Consequently, I had to return the Le Pan  and ordered a iPad.The Le Pan is a really nice tablet at a good price, but it's not much good if can't connect.

Reviews.Title: Nice Tablet For The Money!!
Reviews.Author: Hawaii Lover
Reviews.Content: I have had my LePan II for over three months now and have had very little problems. For my purposes, it is a very nice tablet. I check my emails, surf the internet, and have downloaded games and other apps. I wasn't crazy about the volume rocker and downloaded volume in notification from the Play Store. Works great.....no more fiddling with the volume rocker! I have found a couple of games that downloaded fine but didn't load....Temple Run was one of them. Bummer! Not sure if it's the tablet or the app. I also have transferred movies and music from my notebook to the tablet and they play fine. You may have to check around the Play Store for the best video players to play your movies .........some will play one format smoothly but not the other. I have a 32gb micro sd card for storage which really makes enjoying the tablet nice.For the time I've have it, I have had to reset it twice. I never had a wi-fi problem but since the v118 update it sometimes disconnects after being in sleep mode a long time. At first I panicked but now neither of these two things turned out to be a big deal (so far) to me.  I just either re-connected to wi-fi or powered down and restarted. The only thing I'm waiting for now is the HDMI cable to be available and the HDMI option to re-appear back in settings.I know people are concerned about the upgrade to ICS. I'm not familiar with ICS so I don't know how much the upgrade will improve the performance of the LePan II.  For the time being Honeycomb has fulfilled most of my needs.Check out the Le Pan Life Forum for a ton of info on the LePan. Overall, a nice tablet for the money!!

Reviews.Title: Sleek - handy but limited - no upgrades make it DISPOSABLE soon obsolete
Reviews.Author: QAWeb
Reviews.Content: Googling for MONTHS for how to solve "phone errors", or find any "official" support - the best source for info has been Amazon reviews!  Am writing this review after hunting down the OEM and receiving their email below the six points here:Indeed this device is clean, sleek and 35% cheaper than an Acer, Asus (or iPad).By saving $100, you also: 0. Save a digital tree - ABSOLUTELY NO MANUAL -PRINTED, NOR PDF, NOR by website. 1. Lose ability to use Google Chrome for Android - restricted by Gmail / Google from using their full features.  (highly recommend Firefox *and* Opera browsers) 2. Have no option to ever upgrade - see manufacturer's email below saying they plan to replace/obsolete this item 3. Experience "phone errors" - giving strong indication the Operating System is cloned from a phone 4. If a student of Japanese or other Asian languages, will have have difficulty installing alternate keyboard.  You can change the entire keyboard easily, but to switch to second entry method, more difficult than any competitor I've seen. (Certainly LePan's OEM, having a Chinese website and Japanese name, should be experts at this.) 5A. Gain a reliable email collection / response tool for public WiFi hotspots like Panera, Starbucks, Peet's, Whole Foods, and McDonald's - It is SO VERY PLEASANT to be able to type on a full keyboard instead of the tiny iphone keyboard 5B. Become a WiFi troubleshooting expert: this reviewer could ONLY connect with WEP key - the oldest, and simplest WiFi security / encryption method. It would recognize the more robust AES and TKIP methods but alternately connect/disconnect every 10-15 seconds. Solution was to reduce my router's WiFi security to WEP - and gain full connectivity!! 6. Lose points with your teenager - I offered this to him and he rejected it - says he'll save up for a real pad like Acer, Asus or iPad. Visited Matsunichi dot com - this device is nowhere mentioned.
