Reviews.Title: Superb Lil' Tablet!
Reviews.Author: Rhaiynebow
Reviews.Content: I originally bought this tablet in December. Two of them actually, one for each of the kids (10 years old and 13 years old). They had been begging me for a tablet, and I absolutely WOULD NOT pay over $200 for a tablet for a child. So, of course the iPad was out of the question ;-) I had done a TON of research on tablets at or below the $200 price point. I knew that for my tech saavy kids who both have android smart phones and love them, they would need to have something that at least had the "feel" of an iPad with things like great graphics, ability to play tons of games and of course the capacitive touch screen (NOT the resistive). For those of you who have no clue what those things mean (like me when I first started looking at tablets), basically the resistive version requires a harder "push" on the screen to register what the user wants to do and can be used with gloved fingers, stylus' etc. The capacitive ones are the "cool" ones according to my kids, that register the users intended action with a slight touch giving you the nice "flow" when flipping screens, easy launch of apps etc. Really, capacitive vs. resistive is a personal choice. I've used both and have no issues with either one, although I too prefer the capacitive version.So, after days and days of research, I learned that most of the tablets out there below my afore mentioned price quote had resistive screens instead of capacitive, low memory and had no SD card slot, and did not play well with apps, videos etc. Since the kids use their tablets mostly for game playing and/or video watching while on road trips, those were pretty high up on my list of important functionality.As other reviewers have mentioned, I too was wary about an new company that I never heard of. After reading all of the pros and cons, I decided that for the price, this tablet would give me the most bang for my buck. Now, almost three months later, I'm EXTREMELY pleased with my decision.First off, I LOVE LOVE LOVE the look and feel of these tablets. My mother-in-law has an iPad and she let me play with it over Christmas time, and I actually prefer the Le Pan to the iPad in terms of the overall look and feel. It's sleek, light weight and has a beautiful screen. It feels like a quality product right out of the box. I think my husband was surprised at the overall appearance and quality feel of the tablets. I'm not sure what he was expecting, but he was impressed like I was.Understanding that the Android OS 2.2 version that comes on this tablet is NOT designed specifically for tablet use, overall, their tablets have run just fine. They have had to reset their tablets several times (one of them more than the other), and the younger one seems to be having trouble with lots of apps being forced closed lately. I suspect that rather than a tablet/manufacturing issue, she's downloaded some apps that are not compatible with the OS running on the tablet. We've recently uninstalled, then reistalled several of her apps, and it's now running just fine. I keep asking my hubby to root it like he did with their phones, but he just hasn't had the time yet. I also suspect that after he does that, we will see even more improvement with the tablets functionality, even though doing so would void the warranty. Again, they were fairly cheap for tablets, and they are for young kids. If they crash on them, then they can start saving to buy the tablets they want when they get jobs :-) The only reason that this review is not 4 stars is because of the need to reset and the recent force close issues. Again, I don't think they are the tablet or companies fault, but I just can't rate it 5 stars without being 100% what the cause is. Overall, most apps play well, amazon video plays just fine, as does YouTube. I have not tried Netflix or Hulu, and probably won't since we don't use either of those programs. Also, I added some music files to their tablets and it plays those just fine as well. They love being able to play music from their tablets when they have friends over. Often they will take the tablets downstairs, turn on the music and have their own little dance party! They are kids, so they are fine with the sound. In my opinion, it could be better, however, I was actually pleasantly surprised with it since I had been expecting MUCH worse based on reviews. On sound only, I'd give it a 31/2 out of 5 stars.Actually, I think my husband was a bit jealous since the tablet he has and paid $1000 for doesn't have the capacitive screens like the kids do LOL. He was skeptical of my choice when I originally purchased the tablets (he is the "techy" one in the family) and really wanted me to get them from a known company. Since then, he's conceded that I made the right choice. To be fair, however, we have not had to contact Le Pan directly, so can't speak to their support response times or capabilities.I'm in the market for a tablet myself now, and am trying to decide whether to get the Le Pan II, or wait for the Le Pan III to come out. Either way, as long as Le Pan stays in business, they have found customers for life.

Reviews.Title: Definitely a surprise!
Reviews.Author: Albert Smarowsky
Reviews.Content: This tablet has been amazing so far.  One of the things I do need to say is that if you have any issues, there is an update for it that seems to fix them.  I had looked at probably 30+ tablets, many that were cheaper, but not as up to date (one at Big Lots that was $89, but only had Android 1.5).  I had considered the Kindle Fire, but the main thing that turned me away from that was not being able to add a memory card to it.  I have been surprised so many times with this tablet, being able to play some Facebook games on it, having the full Android market, and the camera isn't too bad.Pros:PriceSize (doesn't feel like there's wasted space, like an Ipad)Can play most Facebook gamesAccess to full Android MarketCons:Without update, almost not usable when battery gets lowFingerprints show up bad (though at the right angle, almost not visible)Speakers are a bit roughI definitely recommend this tablet to anyone that has been wanting to get one, but does not have the money for an Ipad or other "name-brand" tablet.  I can't stress enough though...get the update instantly, it will make a difference.

Reviews.Title: LePan holds up promise of quality, Recommended !
Reviews.Author: PKI
Reviews.Content: Review in Chronological Updates:*** March 1, 2012I ordered this unit for my mom on Jan 22, 2012, it arrived on Feb 27, 2012. 5 weeks is an unacceptable wait, even for a unit this delightful. I also ordered the HTC Evo 4G tablet, which arrived in 2 days so the wait wasnt as painful.That said, I can safely say, this was money spent well. Ive used it for 3 days now, and its holding up to the LePan promise. I used the Len Pan 1(android 2.2), and it impressed me. The Len Pan 2 holds up the quality of hardware and performance. The body feels sturdy, the grip feels comfortable and the software HUMS on the 1.2 Ghz processor. The upgrade to the RAM is a huge benefit, Android 3.2 is animation intensive, so any 'extra' RAM is 'good' RAM.Pros:  Handles Honeycomb 3.2 very well, no lags, no delays  Auto orients to any alignment. The Evo 4G has only 2 alignments(not the end of the world, but useful when operating the tablet whilst charging)  Larger buttons, making the touch-unfriendly Honeycomb 3.2 slightly easier to work with  Better microphone and camera for video call  Gorgeous Display, like the flagship Le Pan  Impressive Battery life. The HTC is 7 inches and guzzles battery life. This one sips for hours.Fixable Cons:  WiFi - Keeps dropping. ***THIS IS A HONEYCOMB 3.2 ISSUE***. I faced the same issue on the HTC, changing from DHCP to Static fixed the problem  Unnecessary widgets running. You can disable these from the settings menu  Skype flickers when beginning a call. Doesnt happen on the HTC. Le Pan needs to fix this, before it becomes an issue.Cons:  Weight is still good enf to make your wrist hurt if u hold too long.  Touch sensitivity needs to be adjustable  Speakers need more juice, video chatting shouldnt always need a pair of headphones  Hard drive space is not 8GB-with-a-pinch-o-salt. More like 6.5GB-with-a-pinch-o-salt. Pretty big 'pinch-o-salt' IMHO.  Insufficient support and extended development timeline for next upgrade. Deal-breaker for those not keen on 'self-helping'I still believe its worth the $280 I spent. Infact, better! My mom is a power-user, the tablet will be put to a test, and from the look of it, its prepared. I'll know and share more soon.

Reviews.Content: This product is bang for the buck. Supports flash and responsive. However it hangs sometimes and the screen keeps alot of fingerprints.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: MTC "S.F. Bay Area"
Reviews.Content: I finally received this today and I am impressed! Fantastic build quality, form factor and performance. No wifi problem at all... I am writing this on my Le Pan. GPS pinpointed my location inside! Display is beautiful. I'll update this after more time on it, but so far so good.Update: Now got it rooted. Google "Le Pan 2 root" to find instructions.Update 2: As of July 13, 2012, I have it on very good authority that the ICS upgrade is coming any day now!

Reviews.Title: Le Pan TC 970
Reviews.Author: B. Gregory "time4u"
Reviews.Content: I had this tablet for about 3 weeks now and I love using it.  I find that it is very fast and easy to use. I only find one bad thing that being the tiny on/off button. However,I am now getting used to that. I tried two other tablets in the same price range. I tryed Kindle Fire and the HP Touch Pad. I brought The Le Pan TC 970 because it was the most functional for me. I like to watch movies. With the Kindle Fire I liked eveything about it but I could not get on the internet with it. And the HP Touch Pad was like a mini computer that could not run the apps. I love my Le Pan. But, I have one more gripe about it, It is that The Lepan Company does not make a case/stand for this tablet. I have been looking for a case that would fit my LePan 9.7 inch display. Since Le Pan does not make a case for their tablet. I have researched reviews on the Le Pan and found three cases that were mentioned that would work with the Le Pan 9.7". I brought and tryed them (Targus Truss,Acase HP Touch Pad HQ and Hp Touch Pad Custom Fit). I found that neither of these three cases worked well. They fitted sloppy and did not secure the Le Pan Touch Pad. I purchased a black leather carying case (sold buy eforcity)that fits a 9.7 display.  I had to make simple adjustments with a mat knife. But, I now have the best case on the market at this time for the Le Pan. I returned the three other cases. If you are looking for a case try this one. I am give this tablet 5 stars

Reviews.Title: Updated Review, Problems Already!
Reviews.Author: CaytieB
Reviews.Content: *****Update 1/23/12*****I have now had this table for almost two months I believe? Anyways, I went to turn on my tablet yesterday, and it didn't respond. I figured it was just dead because I do use it a lot, so I put it on the charger. Today, I tried to turn it on, absolutely no response. Tried to reset it: nothing. I am very disappointed in this tablet. I liked it, but there is no excuse for it not working already. I have not dropped it, and always keep it in it's case. Sending it in asap. Hopefully it'll be resolved soon.I got this tablet about a month ago and so far, I love it. There are a few minor issues with it, though.1. The tablet runs on the Adroid 2.2 OS, and from doing some research, I have learned it will not be able to be updated to the 2.3. Minor issue, but one worth noting.2. I've noticed that sometimes, I have to tap an app a few times or harder than normal to get it to open. I'm not sure if it's just me, but I feel the sensitivity should be a little better.3. It's pretty hard to get cases for this tablet because it is an "off brand." I bought a leather case for it thinking it would work, and although it was the correct size, I could not get to the home buttons when the tablet was in the case.4. The camera is only on the front. Which is great to use it as a webcam, but not so great if you want to take pictures of something other than yourself.Other than that, the tablet is great. Easy to use. It seems very well made to me, and worth the money.Works as well as more expensive tablets. Picture is good, and sound quality is also very good.Over all, definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Easily completes with $400-$500 tablets
Reviews.Author: Andi
Reviews.Content: I bought my mom one of these for Christmas. She's been using an Ipod touch but her eyesight is going so I got her something with a larger screen. I've been teaching her how to use this and I am very impressed.The tablet has a solid build, doesn't feel cheap at all. Seems like the body will last a long time. Screen is responsive. We don't do anything fancy or use the multitouch features but it always interprets zooming correctly. The only thing that has lagged are youtube videos but I couldn't say whether it was buffering the wifi connection or the processor wasn't going fast enough. We don't do anything real hardcore with it but we have played movies, music, tv shows, games, done websurfing and read books but it hasn't show any lag on anything but youtube. The speakers on it are quite impressive. I hear it will get the upgrade to ICS but haven't been able to confirm that yet.The amount of memory that comes with it is a joke but a 16gb microSD card on amazon was less then $20 and a 32GB is less than 40 so that's not a big deal. The lack of ports is the only reason I didn't get one of these for myself. There's no USB or microUSB port. There are not many accessories for it. We are having trouble finding a case since most tablets are 10.1" not 9.7" and I haven't seen a case made specifically for this tablet.In general, this tablet competes with the big boys. It isn't the lightest or the thinnest, it doesn't have tons of ports and features, but it works and it works well at half the price. I heartily recommend this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Fare buy
Reviews.Author: Frax
Reviews.Content: The tablet is good in general, sleek design, except for the power button which is placed on the corner in a way it will be pressed buy your hand manytimes before you learn how to be careful all the time.It is a heavy to be hold in your hand if you are laying on your back.The glossy shinning screen needs to be cleaned very often from finger prints, and its hard to avoid the glare if lights or windws are around. Needs antiglare screen protector(add to cost.Need to be careful with It is sad that technically it is not upgradeable to anything OS beyond Android 2.2, but thousands of applications are available for 2.2. that was not clear at the ordering time.ROM upgrade is available on the vendor's website, upgraded easily.You need to upgrade the memory immediately to16GB or 32GB (add its cost) as it comes with 2GB card that you will discard (loss). Unless you don't use heavy content ( videos, images, audio files).So it is a fare buy, as i think tablets should be in the $100 range in the near future. It is a gadget that will be used for 1-2 years.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet!
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: Although I didn't buy this on here I wanted to leave a review.I just received this today and so far I love it!! I have an I pad 2 but also wanted an android tablet!! This is very similar to my I pad for 1/2 the price! This android is amazing and I highly recommend it! I only wish they had more accessories available to buy for it, hopefully they will soon.You will not be disappointed! The perfect case for this is the CaseCrown Hard Case (Black) for ipad2, just received it and its fits perfectly!

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: The tablet is great for the most part. It has frozen twice but came back to life by hitting the factory reset button. The touch screen is not quite all there sensitivity-wise. The keyboard is the worst part because it's difficult to use and I don't think it's my fingers. I just don't feel it's as accurate as it could be and a little frustrating. This seems harsh but I still give this tablet 4 stars because most things "wrong" about it are forgivable and minor especially given the ridiculously cheap price point.

Reviews.Title: case recommended does not fit
Reviews.Author: technically challenged
Reviews.Content: The leather case with key board that is recommended as the bundle package does not fit the le pan tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: avantnoise
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 Kindle Fires which both me and my wife love. But I did want to use a larger tablet when I am not on the go and also a full fledged Android tablet. Is this tablet perfect no, but it runs every app I love and then some and does it with a beautiful 9.7 screen for the price of $198. I will certainly be getting an upgraded model of the Le Pan soon. On occasion I had to reset the device but not anymore then my Droid phone. I love reading comic books on this thing and using the Kindle app. The screen looks down right awesome. I am glad I took a chance on a lesser known tablet. I would have given it 4 stars but at this price point I had to go with 5.

Reviews.Title: Christmas gift for our 13 year old son - Very satifisied
Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: Our son was very surprised when he opened this gift as he was asking for an IPod. He uses it all the time, loves it and has downloaded many apps and music. His mother and myself are also thinking of buying ourselves one as well..Very happy!

Reviews.Title: Amazing device.
Reviews.Author: JohnA2u
Reviews.Content: Ok, just received my Le Pan II. I have had a Le Pan "I" for about a month so I can make some comparisons. The case is identical except I think they redesigned the power button so it is not so easy to accidently hit it. Hd video- On the Le Pan I, I was unable to watch some HD Music videos. They would freeze after 30 seconds to a minute or just get unwatchably choppy. The II played them instantly and smoothly. Youtube plays in hd without having to go the "dolphin browser Connect as Ipad route"Wi Fi connected without any problem. I do not have an "N" router so My connection speed right now is 54mbps. As far as HDMI output, I am not sure how that is accomplished. The supplied cable is the same as the I. There are no instructions in the quick start guide regarding that and no connectors available on the Le Pan site. They say it will do it but I can't confirm that right now. Per Le pan Hdmi out can be achieved with a 30pin to hdmi adapter .I am at work right now and I need to let this baby charge up, so I will be exploring it more tonight. So far I think it fixes all the little frustrations we have all had with the le pan I. Time will tell.I have had a little more time to play with it and I must say it is awesome. The only downside I can see at this time is it does not get as loud as the Le Pan I for some reason. That is a bit disappointing. The browser in honeycomb is really nice has tabs like dolphin and  google chrome.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: I am a tablet newbie, but wanted to just add my two cents.  I agree with others here about not comparing it to the ipad....I have an iphone and an itouch, and while I won't spend $500 plus for an ipad, I've played around with it alot. For my needs, which is reading and some internet surfing, getting email, this is a great tablet.  I think well worth the $200 I spent and I am happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Idovino Artifon
Reviews.Content: This Christmas I purchase one le pan  tc 97 9.70and another android from China Mica oneI have both and there no comparison the le pan is excellent bright colors is just like the other reviews one excellent tablet I recommend and I also want to emphasize do not order from China you will have the hardest time you your life to return or fix a problem. I lost my money.

Reviews.Title: great tablet
Reviews.Author: walkwithus
Reviews.Content: I love my lepan tablet. I got it for xmas as a gift for myself. I have had some minor issues bcuz i am very new to this. But all in all a great tablet. The apps are great. I have transferred my files easily. You do have to play with it awhile to learn it. It has way more functions than the specs reported you just have to play around with it.  You can email from all your accounts. My new favorite thing is that i can wifi print using  Google cloud print. Download google cloud print to your pc and download the cloud print app from the market its free. Your printer doesnt need to be cloud print ready but it does need to be wifi.The user manual is installed jus press the help icon. Also charge the battery completely at fitst use.I'm still working on video chat.  I can hear and see the other person they can hear me but they cant see me and i cant see myself.As far as freezing it will at times especially if you are pressing buttons like crazy you got to give it time to complete the one function before you ask it to do another and some large apps you may install might have an effect on it freezing as well.I think its a great tablet everyone i show it too is now purchasing one. You do need a screen protector and a good case.I have a folio case for 10.1 size tablets by Caselogic and it works great and i can access the function buttons. I also purchased a speaker dock for ipads and ipods and it works great. I downloaded officesuite pro for creating documents and it includes excel and powerpoint. I just dont know much abt the latter two so still figuring it out so i can print the documents i create via the cloud. If anyone knows let me know. Otherwise everyday i learn a new use for it. Buy it.

Reviews.Title: tablet
Reviews.Author: H4Ranch
Reviews.Content: So far so Great!  This tablet has been very impressive in all ways.  I have already recommended it to family and friends.  The speed, clarity and quality will make you wonder why someone would buy a higher priced $$$ tablet.

Reviews.Title: Le Pan 970
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Le Pan 970 Tablet is really great. I don't see what IPAD could do that Le Pan can't. The display has the same resolution and the sound is quite reasonable. The few apps I've tried work fine. If you like Androids Le Pan is definitely a very good deal. Of course the 2 Gb disk is a bit on the low side but it can be easily and cheaply upgraded.The real question is what is a tablet like that (or an IPAD) good for? I am still trying to find an answer, but it is definitely not a PC.

Reviews.Title: Great Product for a Great Price
Reviews.Author: ozzgood
Reviews.Content: I got this for my husband for Christmas, since we don't have the money for an IPad or any of those pricier type products. He likes to play games and surf the internet, so I thought this might fit the bill. It has done just what we want and more. It actually takes a fairly good picture from the camera, though we haven't tried to skype or anything. The android market has worked well and  though some apps haven't been compatible with it, he's found many he likes. The size and picture quality are great. He's really enjoying it and I feel like I made a good choice for his gift!

Reviews.Title: Absolutely love these tablets!
Reviews.Author: C. Wunderlich "Proud Mom of 7 yr old!"
Reviews.Content: We puchased one of these tablets for each of our six children for Christmas - ages 13 to 29.  They opened them Christmas Eve and every tablet worked perfectly out of the box.  All of them connected to our internet in a matter of seconds and they were all up and running. I just can't say enough great things about them!!  Plan on buying two more - one for my husband and one for myself (keep using my daughters and just don't want to give it back) - love it!

Reviews.Title: happy camper
Reviews.Author: miriam
Reviews.Content: I was really happy with the quality. The shipping was super fast.would buy again.my kids are enjoying the tablet specially with android market.

Reviews.Title: Everything the product claims to do, it does ... And does very well
Reviews.Author: Lee "Funkster"
Reviews.Content: I got the La Pan tablet a few months ago. I've also had my share of tablets from Archos to Playbook and let me tell you ... This is so far the best that I've experienced. The price and screen size makes it a plus. I'm not gonna get into a lot of detail as to why this is an exceptional Tablet, the product description does all that. But I will say this, everything the product claims to do, it does ... And does very well. If your looking for a really good Tablet without putting a dent in your wallet, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: Greatest $200 Tablet on the Market
Reviews.Author: ClarkDee
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this tablet.  My wife got it for me for Christmas, and it has everything that I want.  The android software works really well, but occasionally it will freeze up.  If you have patience and wait, it will get back on track quickly.  It's only done this to me a few times, and it was right after I downloaded a bigger app.  The 2 mp camera on the front gives a high quality picture. The speakers are surprisingly good quality and give a good loud sound.  It has a 30 pin plug, the exact same as an Apple product.  Optional upgrade up to 32 gbs of memory via micro SD.All in all, you get the best bang for your buck out of this tablet.  It's no Apple iPad, but you get what you need and more.  My personal favorite feature over Apple is that I can watch ESPN3 on this.

Reviews.Title: Decent tablet.
Reviews.Author: Sizzlinninja
Reviews.Content: This tablet is pretty good overall, and EXTREMELY good for the price. It freezes up everynow and then, but overall it operates quickly and easily. Would recommend for a friend.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Fiber in VT
Reviews.Content: I have been on a quest to find a good value tablet that actually works. This is such great value. I bought it for my 10 year old and it is almost as good as my $500 tablet. I cant recommend this enough. It is a great product for a great price. The touch screen works well and the speed is amazing.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Brian B.
Reviews.Content: Here is what I wrote the first couple of weeks of owning.Pros:Very nice tablet and great price.  You can't beat the price at around $200 it is a good bargain.  I had it for a couple of weeks now and it does everything I expected it to do and it came with Google Market which is a plus.  Everything you would want with an Android tablet especially if you don't want to shell out over twice as much for an iPad.  Browsing is rather snappy and overall a pretty fast device.Cons:Camera isn't that great but don't really use it anyway. I lost the network twice and had to reboot but don't know whether it was my home router/service or the device.  It saw the network but wasn't connecting so I am not sure where the problem originated.  If you are gaming, the home and back buttons can get in the way when playing sideways.Conclusion:I would buy this again with out a doubt.**************************************************************************Here is my review after owning for a few months: The wireless on the device is definitely suspect.  It won't connect most of the time.  I have tried everything.  Now the power button doesn't work.  I have to plug the device into the wall or eject and insert the memory card to get the device to turn on.  I have tried to find out what I could on the warranty but no luck.  Do not buy this product until they work out the bugs and quality issues.

Reviews.Title: Le Pan
Reviews.Author: drthack
Reviews.Content: A great product so far no complaints, works as ad. however the leather case keyboard does not work with this.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet
Reviews.Author: Norma
Reviews.Content: I got this tablet a couple of days ago and I am very impressed, looks great, works wonderful, has the best battery life of any electronics item I have ever had, love everything about it. Highly recommend it.  My mom who is 70 saw it and wants one cause it is great for those older people to read stuff that maybe harder to read on a computer or cell phone.  I will be buying her one soon.  Overall recommend this 100%, great price. Only con is the fingerprints but, aside from that all is good!

Reviews.Title: LOVE My Le Pan
Reviews.Author: J. Hogue
Reviews.Content: I just receive my Le Pan tablet today and I LOVE it!!! I have been envious of my sisters ipad for quite some time but the price is out of my range.  I couldn't be happier if i had the real thing.  Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Disappointment
Reviews.Author: Pam
Reviews.Content: Received my LePan tablet less than 24hrs ago with great anticipation.  In less than a day the tablet has frozen up twice requiring a "reset". Although the screen clarity is great, ease of set-up there were no instructions included. The screen was less than consistent in responsive touch. I had read all the reviews prior to purchase and felt confident that this tablet would meet my needs, but freezing up twice in less than 24hrs leads me to think that this tablet will be less than optimal. I was unable to write emails as the touch screen did not respond.  This was a disappointment.....and I'll be returning the tablet.

Reviews.Title: A Great Tablet to Own...You will not be disappointed
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet as a Christmas present for my daughter. I was so impressed with it that I got one for myself! A month ago I'd never heard of Le Pan and I just happened to stumble across it when I was doing my research and I think I was very lucky to have. I did not buy mine here...got it at another website for $199.99 which is now sold out there. Anyway, this a a great tablet at this price point - it's very responsive and has a great screen. I've already ordered the antiglare/antifingerprint cover for it. I am looking for a case for it, however, I know that most people are recommending the Targus truss but I came across this review of the Le Pan on netbookdaily (dot)com (Dec 5th post) and it is shown with a case which seems to have been made for it. Have anyone seen this case or know the name of it? Thanks and keep enjoying your Le Pan!

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for the price
Reviews.Author: electrokid
Reviews.Content: I have had my tablet for 2 weeks and have been pleasantly surprised with how good is really is.  I have tried the Ipad2, Toshiba Thrive, Acer, Hp Tochpad.  The android tablets all had problems with the 3.0 os and the hp became a 99 toy...not bad.  The ipad2 was returned due not being able to use flash...but it basically was the best of the bunch.  This little android is pretty close to the ipad 2 and actually better due to price.  If you can live with the idea of not having the latest os, its a keeper.  The battery life has been nothing but amazing.  Yesterday, I had this with me on a day trip and had on from 6am to midnite when I got home and battery life was at 62%.  That was after having my grandson using the tablet for angry birds non stop for 3 hrs, connected to wifi all day while my wife shopped, and then watching a movie on the drive back home.  Not sure why some people complained about the power button, I have found it pretty easy to turn on and off.  I am still using my tablet today without charging yet, and battery life is still at 55%.  The apps are super smooth.  You tube videos seem to run fine, I've had a couple lag a little but nothing I can't live with.  I haven't tried to tether to my iphone yet but the bluetooth worked fine in my auto to play my music.  I also downloaded a printer app to be able to send online docs to the printer. The more I use it, the more I forget why I wanted the new os system anyway.  When u connect to the pc, file transfers are a breeze.Also, I have found a few bluetooth apps that to do wireless file transfers but have not had a chance to try them out.  I did use the skype video calling with no problem...no rear camera, but are u really gonna use this for picture taking?

Reviews.Title: cool tablet......worth 200 bucks
Reviews.Author: jason
Reviews.Content: This is really nice tablet......faster response......goood screen resolution......good speakers and touchscreen.....no problem with skype......no problem whtsoever.....no bad points found yet......only this is tht it wont upgrade to android 4......but do hell with tht........even day after tomorrow could b android 100.....so dont wxry

Reviews.Title: Best thing since sliced bread
Reviews.Author: Gino A.
Reviews.Content: Have had this tablet for about two weeks and absolutely LOVE it. It has everything that I was hoping it would, does everything I want it to do and I personally couldn't be happier with my purchase. The screen is bright, clear and the clarity of images is outstanding. There are some that have said the on/off button was a problem, but I haven't really had that with mine. It "could" be bigger, but the size has not bothered me all that much.The users manual is pretty basic, but, still clear enough to get a person with moderate skills (practically none in my case) going with little effort. Granted the screen is a fingerprint magnet, but, there too, it hasn't been that big a deal.All in all, I am exceptionally happy with the tablet and also my purchase and look forward to many happy hours of use out of this little beauty. As someone on the "net" stated "you are getting 95% of the things the Ipad can do for less than half the price." What's not to like???

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Michael Enghusen
Reviews.Content: I've tried many lower priced tablets and the Le Pan beats them all! Long battery life, fast, Google App store and great screen. Sure it's not an Ipad, but for 40% of the price of one, it ain't bad!

Reviews.Title: Tablet Works for Me. Be careful though.
Reviews.Author: schrism
Reviews.Content: So far I think this tablet is great.  I can't compare it to other tablets because I've never used one, but so far I'm impressed.  It even has GPS and it works!  I only have a few minor issues so far. I pulled out the small cover to get to the SD card and couldn't get the cover seated back as securely as I'd like. In addition, be careful that that you actually turn the tablet off when you're done by pressing the On/Off button and it asks you if you want to power off. It seems that it will go into standby mode (you can set the timeout for this) but it looks as if it has turned off.  You have to push the On/Off button to get back in. I drained the battery by not doing this. (At least that's what I think happened.) I also don't know how to block websites that I don't want my children going to. I'm hoping there's a way to do this.If you noticed in the section above about other items to purchase, there is a USB keyboard for around $25.  Do Not Buy It!  I ordered it and when it came I noticed that it had a USB-A plug and the Le Pan has a 30-Pin port. (I did hook the keyboard up to my desktop and it didn't work well. See my review for it.) I thought that I might be able to use an adapter or converter to get around this, but I emailed Le Pan just to make sure.  I was extremely impressed that they replied in only 2-hours and politely.  Here is the reply:Unfortunately, external USB devices are not compatible with the TC970. If you wish to connect external devices, they must be bluetooth ready.  Thank you.So, at this time, I am very happy with the tablet and Le Pan's customer service.  Just be careful with accessories.

Reviews.Title: Great price, slightly slower than Ipad, battery life is poor, but totally worth it
Reviews.Author: Yang Zhang "Solutionate"
Reviews.Content: I've just got it and tested over the weekend, here are the issues.  I have an Ipad2 before I bought this.  I intend it to be used for watchin movies and for my kid to pay with.Negatives:1.  Not many accessories to choose from.2.  Battery life is not good compared to the Ipad 2.3.  Slower when playing movies, and sometimes there are hiccups if you touch the screen during playback.4.  A bit heavier than Ipad.  about 20% heavier.Positives1.  Android system, easy to get apps, and download movies directly to the Tablet without Itunes.2.  Price, and if you plan on using it less than 4 hrs a day, battery is ok.3.  Expandable Memory cards! Micro SD4.  Overall price/performance is better than IPAD2

Reviews.Title: good deal
Reviews.Author: paulo de tarso
Reviews.Content: I'm impressed with the quality of this tablet. It has a good screen resolution and is very easy to use. This is my first tablet and with the quick stat guide I promptly connected to internet and start navigation. I've already installed some apps from the android market - very easy instalation.The drawback is the mem. size - only 2GB, but one can buy separately a 32GB mem and still will be a good deal.

Reviews.Title: Le Pan Tablet
Reviews.Author: Sandy
Reviews.Content: WOW, This is a great tablet. When you open the box it's all ready to go. The battery life is amazing. I charge it like every two days. Depending on how much I use it. It comes with the a lot of preloaded apps such as the google market. I did notice that I can't download angry birds, but I can download it thru using the amazon app (market). This tablet is just like my android phone, but without the phone dialer. I just love it. The only con that I have is the charging mechanism it just like the ipod changer. I've already kicked the cord and now the charging hole is a little loose. So be careful when charging it.

Reviews.Title: pretty good tablet _ well worthth money
Reviews.Author: HCD
Reviews.Content: Have had this unit about two weeks now and I love it. My wife has an iPad and I would say this compares favourbly.I have my ipod as well and while there are a few differences between the two systems I think the Android will become more popular in the end.Lots of apps available.A good buy.Quick shipping from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: excellent on all aspects but Wi-Fi connection
Reviews.Author: Andre
Reviews.Content: I just got the Le Pan 2 after waiting almost 1 month for it.Overall, Its a great build, great screen, great color and resolution, I can go on and on. It really is pretty impressive for the price if all aspects of the machine works well. the one i recieved however had a wifi connection issue.When I attempted to connect it registered that it had a good signal with my wi-fi device, but when it attemtped to connect....no go.i attempted several times through the day but it wouldnt work. My laptops connected fine and at quality speed so I was sure it was not the wi-fi device.The other odd factor was when the Le Pan was attempting to connect the laptops would get booted off.I wrote le Pan about the issue and their support was quick to respond. they sent me an email with in 6 hours stating I would have to send the product to them for repair/replacement. So for the support, I am impressed with the response time.In the fact that I waited a month and was highly excited to get the Le Pan 2 only to have one that didnt have a proper functioning connection capability, I am a bit disapointed about.With out reliable internet connection the tablet is not worth having.I am hoping I just recieved a defective device. If you do order one and the internet connection works well, then it is probably the best tablet you can get for the price.

Reviews.Title: The Truth!
Reviews.Author: wardell brown
Reviews.Content: Ipad whaaaaaaaaaat! This machine is a monster believe me, you won't go wrong buying one. I can't wait for Lepan 3 to come out!

Reviews.Title: Wifi Connectivity Issues
Reviews.Author: Lanfearz
Reviews.Content: This tablet seems to be blazing fast. However, on more than 4 different wifi networks I have only been able to get 150 kbps. That is incredibly slow and not nearly as slow as an N connection should be.  These are N routers and G routers. I tried three different brands.Hopefully you won't run into the same issue.

Reviews.Title: GREAT PRICED TABLET
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: For those who want a tablet but don't want to spend the cash for a name brand, this is the solution for you!!!  With it priced at almost half the cost of the competition you'd regret if you bought the more expensive brand!  Truthfully this is an amazing product, both my wife and I have had it for about 2 weeks and we love it.  What people don't realize is that most of all the tablets in the market come off the same factory lines, therefore from a hardware perspective there isn't much difference, it's really in the software and the user interface.  Many people still stay loyal to their one and only "Fruit" company and pay the high dollar for the product.  I would suggest this product to anyone who isn't caught up in the name brand and really want to use the tablet for email, surfing, games and some document retrival, which is about 95% of the market.  In short this is the best investment for your money!!!

Reviews.Title: Surprise in a box
Reviews.Author: Sophia "Kindle Addict"
Reviews.Content: I did not have high expectations for this product at all. Maybe that is why I'm so impressed with it. The screen looks amazing! And it's easy to use just like my phone since it has the Android software on it and I love it because it doesn't have all this bloat-ware on it it runs great. It frozed up on a couple of times and all you need to do it push the reset button and the tablet just starts right back up. I would recommend this to anyone who wants a tablet but doesn't want to pay the price tag on the certain "fruit" named "letter" pad.

Reviews.Title: Not so much!
Reviews.Author: Tea, Herb & Milk Soaps "Tea, Herb & Milk Soaps"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE:  5/8/13.  Unfortunately, after three months of use, my third Le Pan TC 970 tablet died.  Amazon replaced this tablet for me twice and I had hoped that after three months of great use from this third tablet, I finally had a tablet that was problem free (NOT SO MUCH!).  Unfortunately, a few months seems to be the life span of these tablets, based on some other reviews I've read and my own.  Feel free to read my comments below, but as my final review, save your money and by a tablet from a more reliable manufacturer.  And by the way, when I finally reached Le Pan, instead of honoring the one year warranty on the TC 970, they wanted me to send them $80 for the Le Pan II.  Obviously, my answer was no.UPDATE:  3/23/13.  It is now 3/23/13 and so far, so good.  My 3rd Le Pan tablet is working great (so far), no issues whatsoever.  Please note that it is now 2 1/2 months since I contacted Le Pan regarding tablet #2 and they still have not responded.  Thank heavens Amazon stepped up to the plate.  It is also now well after the Amazon 30-day return period so any issues will have to be addressed by Le Pan, but based on their lack of response, and though my current 3rd tablet is working great, I will have to leave my rating as a 1.  I will always be a very happy Amazon customer and I keep coming back.  Wish I could say that about Le Pan.ORIGINAL REVIEW BELOW:I purchased this tablet based on the hundreds of positive Amazon reviews and also some very good reviews on Youtube.  The price was great and I also wanted the larger size (9.7") instead of a 7".  Well, I received my Le Pan TC 970 tablet on 12/24, it worked great until it died on 12/28.  I contacted Amazon and they sent me a replacement the very next day 12/29 (of course, I returned the 1st tablet to Amazon).  Well, I've had ongoing problems with the second Le Pan TC 970 tablet.  More than 50% of the time, I would press an app (any app) up to 5 or 6 times before it would finally work.  Not just one or two apps, but pretty much any app.  I also had problems with the android keyboard.  Whenever I had to type, I would also have to hit a key anywhere from 5 to 8 times before it responded and instead of a particular letter or number I wanted, an option list of that same letter or number would open with accents over the letter or fractions instead of a number.  Press the X key to close the option list, then a letter or number, and the same thing would happen, over and over and over again.  Instead of my contacting Amazon, on 1/7/13, I called Le Pan and though the voice message said it would be a 7 or 8 minute wait for a live support person, I waited for over an hour and no support person ever answered.  So, I sent an email the same date to tech support informing them of the problems and the 60+ minutes wait on hold with no response.  4 days later (1/11/13), Le Pan finally responded saying they would send me an RMA # (no apology for the 60+ minute wait on hold and no name of the person who responded to my email) to replace my defective tablet.  As of today, 1/16/13 (9 days after I first contacted Le Pan), I have not had either a phone or email response from Le Pan with the RMA #.  So, I called again, the voice message said it would be an 11 minute wait for a live person, and 60+ minutes later, I was still on hold then hung up.Please note that my complaint is not with Amazon at all as Amazon has been wonderful.  With no response from Le Pan tech support with the RMA # and no one answering at their customer service/tech support line, I called Amazon, explained the situation and the lack of response from Le Pan, and Amazon, not Le Pan gave me the option of a refund or sending me a 3rd tablet.  Amazon is the greatest, but I wish Le Pan had responded as it is their responsibility to handle this matter, especially since my tablet has a one-year warranty.  Because of so many positive responses, I'm willing to give a 3rd tablet a try and have returned the 2nd Le Pan tablet.  I will have the 3rd Le Pan tablet on 1/18/13 (THANK YOU AMAZON, NOT LE PAN!), but when I finally do hear from LePan, I will let them know about their lousy customer service that sucks big time!

Reviews.Title: same bad review
Reviews.Author: WI Bassman
Reviews.Content: The screen and battery stopped working after only two days. We returned it for a refund. I would not recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Worked for 2 months
Reviews.Author: H. Timmons
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet this summer for my niece who is 12. It was great at first but we started having lots of locking up and having to do reset after reset. Then factory reset. Finally they agreed to take it in for repairs. Customer service experience was a nightmare. They had my tablet for almost 2 months. Finally sent it back and it worked for about a week and then started locking up and freezing. Tried to contact customer support everyway possible with no response after a week I'm sending it back to Amazon with this warning. I think this operating system needs to be retired. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Piece of junk
Reviews.Author: Kan
Reviews.Content: it did work for a couple of months & now I can't turn it on..! Gave the problem with the power button for a while. every time i needed to turn it on; I had to plug it in to a power outlet, just like it need to re-charge.it is a piece of junk & advice not to buy it..!

Reviews.Title: Returned for second time
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a good deal and had good reviews. Unfortunately, after 6 months of ownership, I am already on my second return. It will not make it past the LePan logo and just sits there until the battery is dead. Same problem with the first one, and same problem my buddy had who recommended the product to me.I would say avoid this product. I've had an IPad for the same length of time without a problem.

Reviews.Title: Good/bad
Reviews.Author: Unknown
Reviews.Content: Good tablet & horrible customer service through the lepan company, their customer service was so horrible that i returned it before 30 days and got my money back so i didn't have to deal with them in the future.  I called the 1800 number from the lepantab website it took me a few days after calling many times to get a hold of them, they were unable to answer simple questions about my tablet AND on top of that they put me on hold about 5 times, were laughing and joking around in the background, and hung up on me and ignored my calls after the hang up, very disapointed.

Reviews.Title: Very Fast and easy to use
Reviews.Author: RayR
Reviews.Content: I bought Le Pan II after reading reviews of how good it was.  So far it has been everything I expected.  Fsst, easy to use and just as good as the Ipad.  My only issue is for some reason after charging I had to reset in order for it to start.  It has only happened twice.  Once i do that it is fine, it's just annoying.

Reviews.Title: Best Tablet I have ever used + Best Price
Reviews.Author: FreqTabletUser
Reviews.Content: I have used numerous Tablets over the years and this was by far the best deal I have ever seen for a tablet. I expected a lot of problems because of the price, but I have not had any real problems. The Wifi problems were fixed with the update, and beside a couple of times I had to restart it, it has been awesome. The tablet is extremely fast for a tablet thanks to the top of the line specs. The ability to use an SD card is very much under rated. You can add 32gb to the tablet without having to pay hundreds more. Here are a few things I have noticed about the Le Pan II Tablet:PROS:1.) Amazingly Fast. Almost Instant responses on everything I do. The Processor is one of the fastest you will find for any price.2.) SD Card Slot= Alows you to expand the memory by 32gb without having to pay hundreds more like on iPads. You also can interchange cards with movies and TV shows without worrying about filling up your hard drive.3.) PRICE= The best price I have seen for a tablets with this size screen and processor.4.) Screen = Same size as iPad. cant find a tablet this new with same screen size for the price. You can watch movies at angle. I cant tell any difference between watching a movie starring right at the center of the screen vs watching it with my eyes looking right at the side. On my laptop I am constantly trying to adjust the screen position to get a clearer image. Images are extremely bright and clear. HD looking resolution for movies. Love the Color.5.) Dont have to mess with iTunes6.) BATTERY LIFE= I was amazed with the battery life i got with this tablet. I watched more than 7 hours of netflix without having to dim my screen or recharge. Recharging seems to take a long time though.CONS:1.) App Store= tons of apps but just not the number of apps that you can find on ipad but more than you can find on a kindle fire. It still has all the major aps you can find on apple store like netflix, pandora, kindle app, AutoCAD, Facebook, Twitter, and many many more. TONS of games for kids though.2.) Speakers = Speakers dont seem to be that loud even with the sound on max. I normally use ear phones anyways so that has never been a problem with me.OVERALLYou cant beat the price for the quality you are getting. The tablet upgrates to Android Ice Cream Sandwich. It is hundreds and hundreds of dollars cheaper than ipad and matches it on ever spec and more. It is just a little over the price of kindle fire but with a much larger screen. It is cheap in price but definitely not cheap in quality. I cant believe I dont see more of these out there.

Reviews.Title: A bigger version of my HTC Android cellphone
Reviews.Author: JT
Reviews.Content: I've been using the Le Pan tablet for about 3-weeks now.  First off, I have an HTC Evo cellphone that runs Android 2.2.  And this Le Pan runs Android 2.2.  So right out of the gate I was pretty familiar with how to run this Tablet.  But, Android 2.2 is not really designed for use in tablets (there is a newer version of Android designed for use by tables).  So for Android 2.2, not all Apps work well on the table; examples:  Words With Friends is not usable on my tablet and I haven't figured out how to adjust it (the bottom few rows are cutoff on the tablet screen), my son reports some of his app games don't work on the tablet, but luckily for my son all the Angry Bird / Angry Frog / Angry Dad games work great on this Le Pan tablet.In terms of the brand I have never heard of Le Pan.  I even googled their name and there is almost no info out there.  Documentation that comes with the tablet is very sparse as is info on the web.  Maybe the info will increase over time.  This type of info is somewhat important for me because I'd like to know if this tablet will be upgradable to the newer version of Android software designed for tablets.  Also this would help me try to make tweaks/fixes to such things as Words With Friends screen size. +My pros:  Does seem to have good build quality (feels solid), Android Market appears as a standard icon and has been easy for me to download apps, screen display is nice, was easy to get up and running and synch to my home wireless, battery life seems decent, takes micro sd memory card so you can add bigger size. -My cons:  Power Button is very tiny and pain in the butt to turn on and off, sometimes the screen will turn back on for no reason, the 4 Android buttons are backlit but only for a few seconds - so if I'm using this thing in a dimily lit room I can't see where the buttons are and I can't figure out how to adjust the backlight timing (I googled around alot trying to figure this out but no luck), the charging cable is kind of a strange size (would prefer standard usb cellphone charging cable), relatively anonymous company so not sure about future support and info (eg; can I upgrade to newer android software, etc).Now compared to iPad, my friends iPad seems much slicker.  His iPad is faster, screen seems brighter, and everything seems integrated together more.  But then again part of this is just the nature of Apple's closed ecosystem vs Androids open ecosystem.Overall, I give this 3.51 stars (rounds up to 4).  It is a usable tablet, and better to use around the house for me than my Android 2.2 cellphone because the screen is bigger.  But, I deducted 1.49 stars for the cons I mentioned above as well as the fact that at $350 this is a bit pricey in consideration of the cons I listed and other Android options that are out there.  If anything notable occurs subsequent to this review then I'll come back and give an update here.

Reviews.Title: Intuitive product, good fun
Reviews.Author: Princess
Reviews.Content: This is not going to be a technical review, because that's not my forte. I'm a basic user who has never used a tablet before getting this. I never even USED a tablet before!When I received it, I was left to my own devices to figure out how to get it onto our wi-fi. Let me mention that it comes with a single page cheat-sheet and that's it. So, I turn it on and lo and behold, it's relatively easy to configure. Took me about 20 minutes to get it hooked up to wi-fi. For me, that's pretty awesome. Like I said, I'm not a techie. I also began to download games pretty easily.Like another review said, that sound is a bit tinny. It would do well with a 'mega bass' or something like that.Once it crashed on me while playing lots of games at once. I've found that by plugging in the recharger helps get it back.Overall, it's a great product and has stood up to about a month of constant activity with one crash. It's easy to set up for the newbie too.

Reviews.Title: Very nice for the price
Reviews.Author: Howard W.
Reviews.Content: Who needs a tablet computer?  That is what I've been saying to my Apple Fanboy friends since the iPad came out.  Honestly, if it weren't for the Vine program, I would not have gotten a tablet.My first impression, out of the box is, I'm impressed.  It seems to act just like my Android phone.  It is very responsive for a 1GHz cpu.The instructions that come with it are non-existent, a card with where the buttons are.  Their support page gives a URL error.  Their FAQs has no entries except for the specs.Cons:* The sound is very tinny.  It is not very good, especially compared to my friend's iPad.*  No rear facing camera.  So this is only good for chat.  Can't really take pictures or use a scanner app.  A little disappointing.* The auto-brightness doesn't work very well for me.  I think it makes the display too dark under all lighting conditions.* It cannot play trailers from apple.com/trailers.* The system tutorial in Settings->About Tablet doesn't work.  It just returns to the previous screen.* Android 2.2 is not designed for tablets.  Google said this.* The wireless can use 802.11n but only the 2.4GHz band and not the less cluttered 5GHz band.* My biggest complaint is that both the on/off and the volume buttons are very hard to use.  They are too small or too recessed.Pros:* The display is very nice and a good size.* Price, though I think they could have sprung for more than a 4gb card.  Even my phone came with 8bg card.* Battery life seems real good.  I've been using it for over 3 hours over two days and it is at 56%.* The Android system is a plus.  I hope it can be upgraded to 3.0+*  It comes with the Kindle app installed and ebooks look real nice.  I do still like my Kindle better since it is so much lighter.* Touch screen is very sensitive.  I find if I press too hard, it doesn't work. But of course that kind of sensitivity can be bad too, because I press things I don't mean to all the time.Some other notes:  I tried Firefox mobile on it.  It doesn't feel like Firefox and the password manager doesn't allow for a master password and that made me nervous.  Also flash did not work with Firefox, so I removed it.  I do not like the generic Browser on Android.  So I will be looking for a new one.I installed the "Hackers Keyboard" from the app store and really like that.  No more hunting around for special keys, they are all there.I played some games that required interaction of the touch screen and the motion detections system.  Both worked very well.You might think from all my cons that I don't like this tablet, but that is incorrect.  Most of the cons are nits.  If you are looking for a device that you can sit on the couch with, browse the web and check email, this is it.  It would be nice if the speakers sounded better (I'm looking for an equalizer app) and if the buttons were easier to use, but this is a very nice device for $350.Update 5-30-11As of today, I would NOT buy this tablet.  It does somethings nice, but many things including Netflix don't work and Le Pan has not plans to upgrade this to Andriod 2.3 let alone 3.0 or above.  They make a nice tablet and plan to release another 9.7 with 3.0, so I would wait.Update 7-24-12Now that I can, I've changed the rating to 2 star.  It was an okay tablet while it worked with the flaws mentioned above.  But as I suspected, they never updated the software.Also, the Wi-Fi died.Into the recycle bin for this tablet.

Reviews.Title: STOP...........LOOK...........READ.....!!!
Reviews.Author: lawmc67
Reviews.Content: I BOUGHT THE LE PAN 2 FROM  WALMART. I READ EVERY REVIEW HERE , AND NOW HERE IS MINE. This is a tablet, not a pc. Yes it has its quirks, but over all for "THE MONEY", it is the best tablet out there. I have had no problems, with this le pan 2. I am giving it 5 stars because, It does everything I expected a tablet to do.

Reviews.Title: A much cheaper iPad
Reviews.Author: Highmove
Reviews.Content: If you are ever looking for an alternate iPad selection, or give yourself a little more room on the budget for getting a fantastic working tablet or at least follow up the iPad-frantic trend, Android tablet might serve you well in this purpose. For those of you who have used android system elsewhere may find it easy to operate this tablet, though if you never used android like myself still can easily get used to this operating system. However, I must say there are still few other features need to be added or improved. But because it is this operating system, it allow me to organize my schedule and agenda well in two separated windows. I was once really eager to buy iPad for its popularity and a collection of apple product, but almost half of what it cost for an iPad, I changed to android tablet and really found this tablet amazing not only in its price and most importantly its features which is as good and complete as to iPad. So if you are looking for an economically friendly and high-tech functional notebook, android tablet may give you all these desires.

Reviews.Title: le pann II
Reviews.Author: Patricia Allen
Reviews.Content: I do like the tablet, but beware, it is NOT supported by Google, so you won't be able to download any apps. But, you can go to 1mobilemarket.com and download any app you want. If you ever do have to call their customer care line, ask for Raul, he was very helpful in directing me to that site. I was about to send the tablets in (we got two of them) for a refund, but he was able to save me!

Reviews.Title: This tablet is a dud!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tablet on August 8, 2012, had to return to Amazon for a replacement. The second one worked ok for about 4 months then just "died". I returned it to LePan, they sent me another one in April. This one turned out to be worthless also, so  I  returned this one also.  Le Pan sent me another one, the Le Pan ll, which also turned out to be a dud. I am now returning the Le Pan ll for yet another one! This will be my sixth tablet. Wish I could get a refund so I could buy a GOOD one!

Reviews.Title: Cheap, unreliable product, terrible support
Reviews.Author: Tim D.
Reviews.Content: 5 months into the use of this tablet, the power button stopped working. After researching online, I found this problem to be very common. Despite this fact, Le Pan refused to replace the tablet due to the fact that I had a minor crack on the screen, which happened 2 months before the power button failed and it had no impact on the tablet's operation whatsoever. While denying their duty to replace, Le Pan referred to a non-existing text in their own warranty and despite my numerous attempts to simply show them that their position is not based on their own warranty and that the warranty clearly doesn't preclude me from getting a replacement, they kept on arguing that it's their company's position, even if it's not expressly indicated in their own warranty. This is clearly to me a breach of contract and I'll seek reimbursement in one way or another.

Reviews.Title: Great price! Not a great product!
Reviews.Author: mary katherine johnson
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BUY THIS TABLET! It constantly freezes. I read all the reviews and thought that I would be the lucky customer who got the one that wouldn't freeze all the time. I was wrong.

Reviews.Title: Good for the Price
Reviews.Author: Todd C. Swing
Reviews.Content: I had the tablet a little over a week now...  It's pretty good for the price, response time ok when playing with widgets and changing screens, plays netflix, battery last forever and its pretty fast.The CONS:  So far it freezes but not too often, you won't beable to type on it like a IPAD, screen can be unresponsive or slow when typeing, and the battery takes forever to charge, like 3 or 4 hours.  But as stated before, the battery do last forever.I don't like that it doesnt have a rear camera but its ok, I wouldnt use it anyway.  Le Pan said LE PAN III is coming out in a couple of months, I would wait for that one if I was you.  but if the price is good, this tablet is a steal.  I have no real complaint.  I paid 250 with free shippingI bought the HP TouchPad Custom Fit Case  it doesnt fit to well but can do the job I guess.

Reviews.Title: Le Pan 10" tablet
Reviews.Author: htmcc
Reviews.Content: Bought this for Grandma who is pretty computer savvy, but has trouble with a laptop due to the size.  She has liked the many features and the ease that she can share the pics she now gets from her kids.  The 4 rating is due some lags in transitions seemingly caused by processing issues.  No other performance issues or failures since Christmas.  The wireless works great.  Overall like the tablet and keep thinking about buying another one for us.  It's hard to go wrong at $150!

Reviews.Title: Not a bad tablet...for the price.
Reviews.Author: Christopher Shaber
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet as an iPad alternative and I have to say that overall I like it. The screen is clear and the touch sensitivity is spot on. When I use it to show my clients my photography portfolio it adds a bit of flair to my presentation. My ONLY complaint is that it has a tendency to freeze up, thereby necessitating the search for a paper clip to reset it. But at less than half the cost of an iPad, I can deal with it. Plenty of apps available.

Reviews.Title: Works great for the price.
Reviews.Author: Robert M. Acome
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my wife who uses it in the kitchen for her recipes all the time. Works great for surfing the web as well.

Reviews.Title: read the manual; be gentle with it!
Reviews.Author: G. D. Primer
Reviews.Content: Purchased new in box from Big Lots for $245. It was cheapest in my town. So far no problems.The tablet has several quirks: you can't uninstall preloaded apps. You must use third party apk sites (like getjar) for downloading apps (google play DOES NOT support this tablet). Some of the internal apps are wonky at best (chrome browser is crash-prone - use opera). The power button must be held for 7 seconds to power on 5 to power down & 3 to lock screen. The hold button locks the screen auto rotate function. Wireless and bluetooth work great with no problems.I bought a bluetooth keyboard and it works. The tablet also syncs with my cellphone and laptop - I can send/recieve files no problem. After bricking my former tablets (dropping, rough handling, using while plugged in, exposed to extreme temps) I'm more careful with these fragile machines. NOT recommended for children!

Reviews.Title: SUPER GREAT
Reviews.Author: James  massey
Reviews.Content: I PURCHASED THIS TABLET FOR MY SON, THIS THING IS SOLID!! NICE HD SCREEN, SOUND IS GOOD AND VERY NICE CONSTRUCTION!!, I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS LE PAN II ALL DAY!!

Reviews.Title: Its a great tablet
Reviews.Author: melinda j beard
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed by its size its the right size for adult hands the slim design makes it easy to hold iam am an owner of 2 lepan i bought one for my husband just recently and hes been enjoying it as well i personaly havent had any problems with either one and my first lepan is just over a year old and still working great .. great product

Reviews.Title: Plan to return it
Reviews.Author: Seaton Stiles
Reviews.Content: I opened this tablet up on Christmas and was pleased with my purchase... until the next day when the screen suddenly froze up and no matter what I tried--power button, lock the screen, hold button--I could not get the thing to work again. I had to wait until the battery died before I could reboot it and start the tablet up. I've deleted everything off of it and now plan to return it ASAP.

Reviews.Title: Very slow, unresponsive tablet
Reviews.Author: Gimpyeti
Reviews.Content: This tablet is extremely slow. The wireless does not work at all even when the router is within 5 feet away. I would recommend spending a little more money and buying a better tablet because this thing is horrible..

Reviews.Title: medium tablet
Reviews.Author: Ha Vinh Loc
Reviews.Content: i bought this one las tfew days. TO be honest, the touch screen sensitivity is so poor that i could hardly move around the screen. the zoom in and out is also slow. Not gonna recommend. For reference, i could buy a much better tablet, hp touchpad 32gb for the same price much with much more functions.

Reviews.Title: sooooooo gooooood.
Reviews.Author: kamisha
Reviews.Content: I love this thing. I have no problems at all. I looooooooooove it soooooooo much. I would rate it a twenty.

Reviews.Title: Le Pan TC 970 - Does not play YouTube
Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: This product has a really good screen, the size is nice, pictures look good. BUT if you are buying this product to play Youtube then this is not the tablet for you. My daighter (or I) could not get through one YouTube video. I am not sure the reason we tried to clear the cache, use the original YouTube APP and nothing helped. I would not buy this product if you (or your Child) intend on using it for watching YouTube.

Reviews.Title: frustration
Reviews.Author: John Walsh
Reviews.Content: i lost the chargeing cable. called their support to buy replacement to no avail. not a very responsive seller the tablet is of no use to me. prehaps you can offer a suggestion. i have bought several items from your web site that look similar. it was unsuccessful. the tablet was good but without replacement parts i would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Won't Charge
Reviews.Author: TrishSC
Reviews.Content: I've had my Le Pan for a little over a month (Just over the return period!) and it won't charge.  Not sure if it's the cord or the Le Pan II???  Not sure what to do at this point???  This product is very limited in cases, screen protectors and SERVICE assistance with the packaging that comes from Amazon.  The user manual is electronic - which doesn't help if you can't turn it on.

Reviews.Title: Don't recommend, weird stuff happens.
Reviews.Author: ConFu
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: Upgraded to 3 stars (from 2 stars) because Wi-Fi issue was recently resolved with a new update.I was excited for this tablet a whole lot but I am currently disappointed after using it for several months now (to be exact, from mid-Feburary till now). There are numerous issues that are really frustrating for everyday use.Wi-Fi:It connects to Wi-Fi very well but for some reason the highest speed you'll ever get is 1mb/s while my phone (also Android) seem to have no such restriction. This is quite frustrating as streaming movies suddenly can be troublesome and downloading large files (such as games) can be a big big issue. Another issue I've recognized is that it feels like this device always gets the lowest priority when it comes to connecting to routers. What I mean by this is that even though I connect both my laptop and the tablet to my school's network, there are times when the tablet just gets absolutely turtle-speed (imagine 1 minute wait time just to open a webpage) while my laptop works slower than usual but not annoyingly so (10 seconds to open a webpage).UPDATE:According to a comment of this review, newer Le Pan II tablets do not have this issue. Also, an update was released around 2 weeks after this review came up that fixed the Wi-Fi issue. You can update through lepantab.com's website.Freezes/Shutdowns:Occasionally, the tablet just shuts off or freezes (the first happens more often). It happens most often when there's a lot of stuff going on as if there's no safety net for how many applications can remain open. That said, sometimes it just shuts off without reason too. I really have not figured out why it happens.Not Stable:While this kind of goes into freezes/shutdowns issue there are also times when there are slowdowns and the tablet runs slower than usual. It is definitively not as reliable as other tablets out there.Support:Le Pan (the company) has a history of promising updates and not follow through with the updates. When I say history, I'm being a little bit unfair as it only happened once (with TC970) where a Gingerbread update was promised but then later said "was not possible". I bought Le Pan II without knowing this information and was quite excited for a Ice Cream Sandwich update but there has been no words about this update at all ever since it launched. History repeats?UPDATE: An firmware upgrade that fixed WiFi issues were released (although it was 4 months after release). Also, ICS upgrade has supposedly been spotted and supposed to be released at the end of May but this is NOT official (i.e. this information did not come directly from LePan)Minor issues:The following things I knew before hand so I consider it my fault for not knowing the severity of the faults so I thought I mention them just in case. Ok, the glare on the screen is BAD! It's almost unusable outdoors on a sunny day. The screen h/w ratio, size and resolution is not common and thus there are some applications that acts a bit weird (though most works fine). Front camera feels kinda muddy, it's not crystal clear despite a decent resolution. Oh and no rear camera, I didn't think it would matter but I found an application that would allow me to take a picture and write notes as well, which would've been very useful to me as a student.Last words:Despite all my issues, I think it's a decent tablet. It works generally okay and most apps are compatible. Watching movies and reading books is great (except for outdoors as noted above). If the tablet is compared to the terrible tablets, it comes out on top. If compared to the good tablets, it comes out at the bottom. I regret my purchase but not enough to sell the tablet and buy a new one. However, if I were you I would definitely look elsewhere. I personally would look at the Acer or Asus tablets, they should be very close to Le Pan II's price now and has marginally better specs (like larger internal storage and possibly rear camera).

Reviews.Author: An
Reviews.Content: This Tablet doesn't work, the internet never work, is on and off all the time, it a lot of problems.

Reviews.Title: Gave it a second chance
Reviews.Author: Bhee "Bhee"
Reviews.Content: ** Original Review **This tablet is pretty easy to use and I love the size of the screen. I downloaded a couple games and out of 10-12 tries, I was able to play only once. I never got the Kindle app to work. But the most frustrating part is that it froze every 5 or 10 minutes.  I ended up sending it back.  I looked for another tablet to buy, but nothing was as good as this one is.  Since so many reviewers did not have the freezing issues that I had, I'm buying another LePan and see how that goes.  Glad returning is easy (first 30-days).** Update 4-26-12 **I received the new LePan 970 and before doing anything I downloaded and installed the newest firmware.  After 4 weeks of constant use, I'm happy to say the device has not frozen once. I'm reading with the Kindle app and playing games.  Absolutely no problems! I've updated my review from 3 stars to 4 stars and would not hesitate to recommend this tablet to others.  I would gladly buy it again.** SECOND Update 6-25-12 **The On-Off Switch in not working, and for a while I was able to turn it on via the reset button.  Now that no longer works and I can't get it to turn on at all. I did not put this in a case - I guess I should have. I notice that the 2-year SquareTrade insurance that I bought for $44 is now $59. Wow. I am so glad I bought the insurance. Downgrading my review from 4 stars to 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet for the price but you get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: DasBier
Reviews.Content: I got this tablet for my girlfriend's birthday in February 2012. She has an aging laptop that she used for surfing the web so this is a nice, inexpensive replacement that lets her surf the web, play games and read books, at a fraction of the cost of an iPad or other high end tablet. I have been able to compare the Le Pan with an iPad 2 that I borrowed from work. I have used the iPad for a while now, and the Le Pan has several advantages:-Price. Can't say more.-You can load flash websites. It seems with the iPad I have to open up a lot of websites on the computer (online banking, etc never seem to work right)-More free/cheaper apps. By comparison, apps for iPad tend to be more expensive/fewer free apps available (and the free ones are full of ads)-Has built-in GPS (haven't used it much)The Le Pan 970 has some disadvantages:-It does freeze, it seems everyone has a different experience. This one locks up every few hours, especially if using one program (e.g., reading a book or playing a game) continuously. As others have pointed out, I upgraded the firmware right when I got it but the Le Pan still freezes. She keeps a paper clip handy all the time to reset it. Or, you have to remember to close out of the app you are using periodically, although that is not a guarantee.-It is not quite as fast as the iPad. Loading websites, zooming in, etc. takes a second or two longer. Maybe the iPad is faster because it ignores the flash content in many websites.-The camera is backwards. I use Skype with the iPad and it works beautifully, seems with the Le Pan a lot of people report issues.-It runs the somewhat dated version of Android that according to others, was meant for smartphones. So, a lot of websites open up in the mobile version, which can be annoying.All in all, a good tablet if you're on the fence and if you are like me and don't want to spend a lot on a tablet--especially considering that for the price of an iPad you can buy quite nice laptop that lets you do a lot more and get work done. But this is a great tablet to check email/facebook/news while eating breakfast, read a book on a boring day at work or play angry birds. But, only 3 stars because of the fairly frequent (about once daily) freezes.UPDATE August 2012: The freezing got so bad (she had to have a paper clip in hand all the time), she had to send it in to LePan. The customer service is terrible, it took about 6 weeks to get it replaced. 3 Months later, the replaced tablet freezes less often, but still locks up unexpectedly and behaves erratically once/twice a week (apps won't load, websites freeze up) even after rebooting. So, once a month she has to do a factory reset and reinstall everything.
