Reviews.Content: received tablet in the mail and cool it looked great set it all up put in the 32 gb card ( by the way if you return the card they charge you 4-5 $) set up to amazon prime uggg the stream of the video was unwatchable seriously unwatchable... the sound was good though... pandora worked great.. then came the transfer of a movie to the device ... no luck the device shuts off during download then I had to reset every time the screen slept. so long story short i ended up returning as defective they charged me $10 to return a broken item... nice huh... and bought a second kindle fire... these are awesome.

Reviews.Title: Impressive Toy
Reviews.Author: Joseph P. Lacerra
Reviews.Content: My Le Pan tablet is really nice and it is fast, and has a great screen view.  It is a solid piece of business.  Other than the smudge-magnet screen, I have no complaints.  My review title is based more in the view of tablets in general, and perhaps Android in particular.  You see, the thing does not seem to do anything I am interested in doing, or conversely, it does only those things I am not interested in doing. While it easily set up a Gmail account, which I did not really want, it is unable to set up a Yahoo Mail account, which I desperately did want.  While I wanted to increase my productivity, without email this thing is really just a hunk of plastic and aluminum. I have also failed (about 20 times) to get an Amazon Apps account set up.  Interestingly, neither Yahoo nor Amazon have been any help at all.I have already paid for and downloaded a number of productivity apps (through the Google Market that comes in the Le Pan), but they are moot without the email.  If you like Android and tablets, this unit is excellent.  I, however, am going to stop hauling this thing back and forth to work; it is simply a time waster.06.01.2012:Most of the issues I mention above have been corrected; I have Yahoo Mail.  Unfortunately, I have grown to dread using this tablet.  I type a lot, but the virtual keypad here is so sensitive that I hate using it.  Also, the unit seems to have weak WiFi reception.  So I leave my rating the same.

Reviews.Title: Didn't really need a tablet, but now I can't do without it
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Priscilla G"
Reviews.Content: I work on a computer all day and night, have 2 at work and 2 at home. A Atrix Android phone, so I really didn't need a tablet, but this one was so reasonably priced, and I was curious about reading books on one, but didn't want a Kindle that you have to use a light to read at night in bed. And iPad's were just way too expensive. I got it right before Christmas, so haven't had a lot of time to add a bunch of apps, but LOVE IT. I read in the bathtub, so was worried about that, but a gallon zip lock fits it perfectly (just in case I get water on it). And am loving reading it there and in bed at night. Have used the GPS (google maps) and may look in to a better one, but live in small town, so it isn't really something I need much. It opened up, and looks just like my android phone, so felt right at home. I used to have an iPhone, but traded up to Android. I'm nearly 68 years old, but have alwyas been a geek, so I like the control that android gives me, over a controlled iphone or ipad. So for only about 4 weeks of ownership.. I have to say its a great deal! Its fast, has a beautiful screen and resolution (same as iPads) at a fraction of the cost. And with Amazon's Square Trade 3 year warranty, because its under $200, that was only $29 bucks! How can you beat it?

Reviews.Title: BEST ANDROID TABLET FOR THE MONEY
Reviews.Author: mars "Americanshores"
Reviews.Content: A couple of months ago, I had purchased the newer version of the Lepan Android Tablet, the Lepan II  for $260.  For the price paid, I was not totally satisfied with its performance.  I returned it and bought the previous older model of the  LePan  Android 2.2 Froyo for only $130.  This older model is just as good as the newer more expensive one.  I am so totally captivated by it.  First of all, just bear in mind it is not an Ipad or a Samsung  Galaxy Pad, but neither is the price.  So with that in mind,  do not expect somersaults out of it.  It has a beautiful bright almost 10" screen.  It downloads and plays many movies and tv shows from Netflix, Youtube, TV.com, NBC Nightly News, The Rachael Maddow Show, Newsy, CNN, CBC/The National, (Canadian nightly news show), Crackle TV, PBS, C-SPAN/Washington Journal.  In addition it is a great EREADER.  I have been able to download many national and international Newspapers, and magazines like Time magazine to mention one.  It has a full Android Market already built in, and Amazon Kindle as well.  Connects to GMAIL, YAHOO MAIL and FACEBOOK.  Also I have downloaded Google Earth and already came with Google Maps and GPS.  It has a voice recognition device to let you browse the internet with your own  voice.  Downloaded Orbitz, Kayak,  Hotels.com, Amazon, Wikepidia and many more useful gadgets.  This original older version of the Lepan Android 2.2 Tablet, is a really little jewel.  If you are like me and will use it only for mundane entertainment, you will not be disappointed  with it.  On the other end, if you need a school or college type of Tablet device,  I am afraid you will have to look into higher priced Tablets like the Samsung or Ipad.  Better yet,  at that point, I would get a small 12" Laptop that will work better than any high priced Tablets, and would be much cheaper as well.  But again, if you like me want something to entertain you on the go....You will be very pleased with this great Tablet.  You will not go wrong.  BTW....When the Tablet is fully charged....It will last for about 8hrs.  I think for $130 you could not buy a better Tablet out there....I hope the rating of this tablet has helped you decide.......

Reviews.Title: Mixed feelings
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: Impressed - Tablet Broke - Now disappointedI was looking for a multi touch Android tablet and this one had all the features I wanted, at a good price. Ordering was easy and it arrived quickly, in about 2 days. Very impressed with look and feel, speedy and easy to use. I noticed I was not on my laptop as much and the Le Pan was great for Facebook, email, web browsing. Like others I read earlier reviews and was eagerly awaiting the release of ICS, that would round out the rough edges of the Le Pan on Froyo. Very disappointed that it now sounds like this won't be happening.After 3 months of using the tablet daily, on Thanksgiving day the tablet just would not turn on. I opened a ticket on Lepantab.com site and was impressed that support replied in about an hour. After trying their suggestion the Le Pan would still not power on, so the next day I was issued an RMA and had to pack and ship to CA for repair or replacement. Since it was at my expense I picked UPS ground shipping and that took the tablet a week to get back to Le Pan. The same day the broken unit was received they shipped out another tablet. The replacement also took a week via UPS ground. I was lucky that I had backed up my apps about 3 weeks before the crash so in about an hour most everything was back up and running. So far the replacement is running, just as well as the first one. Just waiting for the day it becomes a paper weight again. I hope this happens prior to the one year warranty running out and that Le Pan is still in business. Although if no OS upgrade is offered I think customers will abandon Le Pan and pick a reliable established name brand.Still a fan of Android and very happy with Froyo on my phone. BTW my phone shipped with Donut, phone company skipped Eclair but did offer the update to Froyo....that is good support and standing behind your customers and products. Maybe Le Pan will at least support it's customers with a update to Honeycomb, the tablet version of Android.

Reviews.Title: Don't Believe The Hype
Reviews.Author: Vivian M. Reed
Reviews.Content: Le Pan II 9.7 inch tablet pc with 8 GB flash, available to upgrade to Android 4.0.4 I purchased the le pan II after reading the reviews on Amazon as well as researching it on line. I am currently an owner of an Ipad which I truly enjoy. I was looking for something less exspensive for my husbands birthday.  The majority of the reviews were very positive, I was a little hesitant, but also excited because of all of the features described.  Out of the box it looked and felt great, but soon after that, I realized it "ain't no Ipad".  It would have a full battery, and 100% wifi signal, but would say no signal.  It would be fully charged, but would not come on. I had to reset it weekly.  I would use my Ipad at the same time as my husband attempted to use the le pan, but he wouldn't be able to get a signal, or it just wouldn't turn on at all. We use the pads to surf the internet and read email mostly. The le pan performes poorly at these simple task.  I was very disappointed, and upset with myself for wasting my money. I should have saved it and purchased the Ipad.  I could not in good conscious recommend this product to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: Danny Parker
Reviews.Content: This product is not worth spending your money on.  I ordered one last year. It started messing up in about 6 mos., but kept it and gave it the benefit of the doubt. It continuously got worse, and just shut down completely. Got in touch with LePan and they did replace it, but it was right at the year mark. The new one I received started messing up immediately. Screen would freeze and I would have to reset it. It got to the point that I would have to restart it 6-8 times within an hour. It then started to show horizontal colored lines, but nothing else. It would not turn on without resetting it. After this, it would not turn on without it being plugged in and resetting it. Final straw was 2 nites ago when it did not respond to anything. LePan has told me that my warranty with them did not extend just because they sent me a new tablet and they would charge $100.00+ to ship & fix it. This does not say much for their company or their product. I will not order anything else that has their name on it.

Reviews.Title: WARNING: STAY AWAY!!!!
Reviews.Author: A. Oganesyan "White Devil Productions"

Reviews.Title: 3 weeks and still going strong ......

Reviews.Content: I am a techie and I am impressed.  Price is right, great screen size and resolution, nice design, performance is good. I am able to watch Netfix and You Tube - no problem.  Downloaded a ton of games for the kids and surf the net with no issues.Only once, after an overnight charge it would not power on. Wrote to Le Pan and got a reply within an hour with 4 options to try. I already did two of them and moved onto using the reset on the back.  Followed their directions and it came back with out lossing anything. Reviews.Title: Nice product.Bit heavier than I thought it would be.

Reviews.Author: dody
Reviews.Content: this product sucks half the time it wont charge and if it does it takes like 8 hours and not only that but always freezes or shuts off and stays on the tittle screen or just keeps restarting. pile of garbage stay away

Reviews.Title: Sluggish
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Herrmann
Reviews.Content: Nice looking device which I so wanted to work well, but it turns out to be another tab with inconsistent wifi bandwith and sluggish web browsing, which is my primary use.  Download speeds would range from less than .5 mbps to 15 mbps and latency went from a best of 73 ms to 323 ms.  Just too slow loading web pages and unresponsive.

Reviews.Title: For email and basic browsing maybe...
Reviews.Author: K. Seleen
Reviews.Content: First I must say the build quality is impressive as others have noted. It seems many reviewers are first time tablet users, so I also feel it's important to mention that I am tech savvy, and I have used a wide variety of tablets and smartphones.The Le Pan had intriguing specs and good reviews and is at a price point that android tablets will be most competitive against the ipad elite. But, I'll boil this down...1) It is good for what you pay - great screen, nice looking body, easily handles gmail and simple web browsing... Does well with angry birds and the like... But nothing more video-intensive2) LAG - video playback is a struggle, simply moving around in android has noticeable delay at times - just sliding around using multitouch has a distinct lag compared to my touchpad and direct comparisons of youtube and flash playback were very blocky and disappointing3) Support - several reviewers stated positive comments about le pan support... Le Pan was completely unresponsive to all 5 of my emails with simple questions when I was deciding whether or not to buy and no one was available to answer the phone the 6-7 different times I called over a 3 week period. I am not at all impressed.4) I returned the TC 970, it's just not up to par. The Le Pan II has impressive specs and could potentially perform nearly as well as my touchpad, but the total unresponsiveness of the company would keep me from buying.  Even though the HP touchpad is defunct, you can still always reach a support person.

Reviews.Title: Bad product
Reviews.Author: ifemi "Book Brain"
Reviews.Content: This product need to be pull off the site. The storage is small and it doesn't work some of the time. This made-in-china product is one of the ones we can do better here.

Reviews.Title: Lasted 6 days

Reviews.Content: I had a short list of tasks for which this appeared ideal.  Since it's inexpensive I got one.  Wouldn't connect to my router... Went to a cyber cafe... Slow Slow Slow... Utube blocked 'mobile' devices... Gave up, went home... Moved four files from my PC to the Le Pan... It froze up on the fifth... Wouldn't start after that... Sent it back to Amazon, thank you very much.  Saving for a real iPad...

Reviews.Title: Piece of Crap
Reviews.Author: Jstuck
Reviews.Content: I've had this tablet for two months. I'm not even going to get into all the ways it sucked in those two months. What's most important is that it's now broke. Won't turn on and won't charge. Can't even use it. Piece of sh*t!!

Reviews.Title: Dubious Reviews - Don't Buy
Reviews.Author: Ecas
Reviews.Content: Careful!  Many of the 5-star reviews seem fake - not the typical reviews of a normal consumer.  This tablet is very poorly made. From the start, we had to reset it several times per day.  It died a week ago and we have had zero luck with the manufacturer.  The support line is always busy and there is no email response.  I looked at other online stores; several have stopped offering this product.  I believe many, many people will continue to have problems with these tablets.

Reviews.Title: This one didn't Pan out
Reviews.Author: JohnDoe155
Reviews.Content: There are 3 major problems with this device:1) WiFi network issues (also documented by other users on couple of forums)Most of the time YouTube is unusable, both via dedicated application and the browser. Soon after playback starts it starts buffering and buffering never stops.Similar problems occur with Netflix and any other apps/processes that require streaming and/or downloads. I observed it even on Google Market where most of the apps are pretty small - download/update starts, then stalls for several minutes at 10-20%, then resumes several minutes later. At the same time 2 other devices on the same WiFi network (laptop and Android phone) exhibit no such issues whatsoever.2) Lack of official Windows driversThere are no official Windows drivers available, so when plugged in device is not mapped to the drive letter in Windows Explorer. Other users reported on internet forums that they received email from Le Pan support stating that they will not release drivers to the public.I emailed support regarding driver availability and received no response at all.That being said there are unofficial drivers for the previous model of this device (970) that has been hacked to work with LP II. I have not tried them and can't comment on how well they work or if they can be used for doing software development on this tablet which was my intended usage (I am talking about development of regular Android apps that do not require device to be rooted).3) Source code for OS has not been published. As far as I understand this is a violation of license for Android OS.I am sending device back mostly because of WiFi problems and lack of drivers. Considering unresponsive support, lack of drivers, root not being achieved and source code not being available I am not holding my breath for WiFi problems to be fixed.

Reviews.Title: Think before you buy

Reviews.Content: I've had this now for about a month. What inspired me was the upgrade to Android ICS (Ice Cream Sandwich). Yet ICS was released i think Nov 2012 officially, LePAn STILL have not released the the upgrade. More info goto lepan life forums to view many disgruntled purchasers.

Reviews.Title: Worst Tablet ever
Reviews.Author: ranman
Reviews.Content: Thought this was a good product according to specs. Received the le pan 2 on a tuesday, froze on Wednesday. Hit the reset button and worked fine for one day then restarted on it's own and froze at the le pan startup screen. Returned and forked up an extra $100 for an Asus Transformer TF101 and couldn't be happier. Word to the wise cheaper is not always better. don't waste your time.Also support is terrible. Try calling the support number before you buy, you will only get an answering machine. They also lied about the tablet being able to upgrade to ICE Cream Sandwich. Asus tablet upgraded as soon as i turned on Wifi!Hope this helps those in search!

Reviews.Title: Passable, good for the price.
Reviews.Author: private
Reviews.Content: After having this for some months, it seems a good time to update the review.The Le Pan works okay as a reader and as a browser if you are close to your wifi and i have been able to get Skype working on it, sort of.The screen size and aspect ratio is quite nice for those apps that are able to use it.There are a few issues1. It does not support Android past 2.2.  This creates other limitations.2. Plan on buying a Map/GPS App if you want to use this feature in situations where wifi is not available.4. The button that locks the display orientation, instead flips it back to a landscape orientation and then locks it.5. The screen blanking function only allows choices from 30 second to 30 minutes, there is no disable. Unlocking takes time, so if you want to use it as a music stand, you probably do not want to set a password or pin to protect it.After the latest software update, all of the above seem to still apply.  But given the price, it can be a good deal.
